snippet.title: Refugee crisis deepens at the Polish-Belarusian border
snippet.description:
On the Polish-Belarusian border, thousands of people have gathered at the barbed wire fences, having believed Minsk’s alleged false promise that they would be able to cross into the European Union territory.

Poland and its allies say Belarus has encouraged people to travel to Minsk and head to the border, in a bid to destabilise Europe. Belarusian authorities have reportedly provided refugees and migrants with fence cutters for their attempted crossings.

snippet.title: Why Haitian migrants are fleeing Chile to seek asylum in the US
snippet.description:
Thousands of Haitian immigrants, who have been living in Chile for years, are now leaving the country.
Faced with discrimination and stricter visa rules, many want to head to the United States. 

Al Jazeera’s Lucia Newman reports from Santiago, Chile.

snippet.title: Is this the end of China's experiment with capitalism? | Counting the Cost
snippet.description:
Since President Xi Jinping became head of the Communist Party in 2012, he has launched an anti-corruption purge, interned millions of Uighurs and crushed the hopes of pro-democracy protesters in Hong Kong.

Now, Xi has got his eye on a huge segment of the economy that has powered economic growth in recent years: billionaires, celebrities, property, gaming and technology companies. He argues the side-effect of growth has been inequality and that it is time for “common prosperity”. Iris Pang, the chief economist for greater China at ING Bank, sheds further light on this.

Plus - why collectors are snapping up second-hand watches during lockdowns, according to the Founder and CEO of A Collected Man Silas Walton.

snippet.title: Abimael Guzman, head of Peruvian rebel group Shining Path, dies
snippet.description:
One of the most notorious figured in Peru's recent history has died after 29 years in prison.
 Abimael Guzman was the founder of the Shining Path, a hardline armed group.
 An estimated 69,000 people, mostly in Peru’s poor interior, were killed between 1980 and 2000 in the internal conflict launched by the group.
 
Al Jazeera's Mariana Sanchez reports from Peru's capital Lima.

snippet.title: Afghanistan: Head of new Afghan government calls on ex-officials to return
snippet.description:
Afghanistan’s new acting prime minister, in an exclusive interview with Al Jazeera, has called on former officials who fled when the Taliban seized power last month to return to the country, saying the group “will guarantee their security and safety”.
Mullah Mohammad Hasan Akhund also said on Wednesday that the caretaker government would guarantee the security of diplomats, embassies and humanitarian relief institutions, stressing that the group wanted to establish positive and strong relations with countries in the region and beyond.

snippet.title: As Moroccans prepare to vote, what are the key challenges?
snippet.description:
Morocco is holding a general election on Wednesday but the turnout is expected to be low as many people are frustrated that political reforms that were promised have not materialised.
Some young candidates have been trying to regain the trust of people and convince them to head to the polls.

Al Jazeera's Bernard Smith reports from Rabat, Morocco.

snippet.title: Guinea coup: Army detains President Conde, dissolves constitution
snippet.description:
Soldiers have detained Guinea's President Alpha Conde in a coup.
On national television, coup leader Mamady Doumbouya the head of the country’s special forces says the borders are closed and the constitution dissolved.
The United Nations and the West African economic bloc, ECOWAS have condemned the military takeover. 
Conde won a third presidential term in a widely disputed election last October.

Al Jazeera’s Nicolas Haque reports.

snippet.title: Montenegro protesters, police clash over church head inauguration
snippet.description:
Protesters have clashed with riot police in the old capital of Montenegro, setting up blockades before the inauguration of a new head of the Serbian Orthodox Church in the small Balkan nation.
The ceremony planned for Sunday in Cetinje has angered opponents of the Serbian church in Montenegro, which declared independence from neighbouring Serbia in 2006. Since then, pro-independence Montenegrins have advocated for a recognised Orthodox Christian church that is separate from the Serbian one.
For protesters, the upcoming inauguration of Metropolitan Joanikije is viewed as creeping Serbian influence – an attempt by Serbia to occupy the small Adriatic country or pull it into the so-called “Serb world”.
Al Jazeera's Zein Basravi reports.

- Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish/
- Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/aljazeera/
- Check our website: https://www.aljazeera.com/

snippet.title: Will Taliban rule be different this time in Afghanistan? | Inside Story
snippet.description:
Millions of Afghans who lived through the 1990s remember the Taliban's harsh rules and governing style.
But the armed group says - it has changed. As it gets ready to lead the country once again.
In its first news conference since taking Kabul on Sunday, the Taliban promised to protect women's rights, give amnesty to those who worked with foreigners and respect media freedoms.
Its leaders also said they will not let other groups use Afghanistan to launch attacks on any country.
And they've called on women and other minorities to join their government.
But many Afghans and world leaders are skeptical.

So, has the Taliban changed its ways?


Presenter: Mohammed Jamjoom.


Guests:

Fahim Sadat - Head of the International Relations Department at Kardan University.

Michael Semple - Practitioner Chair at the Senator George J. Mitchell Institute for Global Peace, Security and Justice at Queen’s University Belfast.

Omar Samad - a former Afghan Ambassador to France and Canada and a former Adviser to Afghan Chief Executive Abdullah Abdullah.

- Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish/
- Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/aljazeera/
- Check our website: https://www.aljazeera.com/

snippet.title: Haiti security chief of presidential palace in custody
snippet.description:
United States President Joe Biden says a limited number of US Marines would be sent to Haiti to secure the American embassy there after the assassination of President Jovenel Moise.
Haitian police have arrested the head of security for the presidential palace, as they investigate the murder.
Al Jazeera's Katia Lopez Hoda-Yan has more.

snippet.title: Space tourism: Billionaires race to develop emerging industry
snippet.description:
The private space race is finally here, as one of the three billionaire businessmen is closer to his dream of taking tourists into orbit. 
Richard Branson's Virgin Galactic and Jeff Bezos's Blue Origin, along with Elon Musk’s SpaceX, are competing head-to-head in the emerging space tourism business.
The success of these ventures could pave the way to making space tourism mainstream, at least for high-paying customers.

Al Jazeera's Rob Reynolds reports on how we went from space travel to space tourism.

- Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish/
- Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/aljazeera/
- Check our website: https://www.aljazeera.com/

snippet.title: Andrew Brown Jr executed by ‘kill shot’ to his head: Lawyers
snippet.description:
Lawyers for the family of Andrew Brown Jr, a Black man shot by officers in North Carolina said police body-camera footage and an independent autopsy showed Brown was shot in the back of his head during an attempted arrest.
They called his shooting last Wednesday "an execution" and said all footage of the incident should be released.
Police called on demonstrators to return home ahead of a nightly curfew on Elizabeth City.

Al Jazeera’s Mike Hanna reports from Washington, DC, the US.

snippet.title: Cuba: Raul Castro to step down as head of Communist Party
snippet.description:
Cuba's leadership is passing to a younger generation.
Raul Castro, and before him, his brother Fidel, ruled the island for 60 years. Whether he remains in the Communist Party in a lesser capacity, or as an elder statesman, it is unlikely to mean his influence has ended.
Al Jazeera's Latin America Editor Lucia Newman reports.

snippet.title: Bulgaria election: Voters head to polls as PM Borissov seeks 4th
snippet.description:
Voters in Bulgaria head to the polls on Sunday for a general election.
Prime Minister Boyko Borissov is hoping to win a fourth term with his centre-right GERB party.
No major party is likely to win an outright majority.
But Borissov still looks set to cling to power.

Al Jazeera’s Bernard Smith reports from Bulgaria’s capital Sofia.

snippet.title: Bangladesh security forces ‘colluding with criminal network’
snippet.description:
Al Jazeera’s Investigative Unit has uncovered a criminal network colluding with the security forces of Bangladesh which is profiting from powerful links with the country’s prime minister.
Our investigation found evidence that General Aziz Ahmed, head of the Bangladesh Army, helped criminals to evade justice and make money from state corruption.

snippet.title: Biden, Harris leave US Capitol after inauguration
snippet.description:
President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris have left the United States Capitol after both being sworn into office.
Biden called the coming days “a time of testing”.
“We face an attack on our democracy and truth, a raging virus, growing inequity, the sting of systemic racism, a climate in crisis, America’s role in the world,” Biden said.
“Any one of the these would be enough to challenge us in profound ways. But the fact is, we face them all at once, presenting this nation with one of the gravest responsibilities we’ve had,” Biden said.
Biden is expected to head to the White House, where he will sign a flurry of executive orders, including halting construction of Trump’s border wall and reversing the travel ban that targets predominantly Muslim countries.

Biden called the coming days “a time of testing”.
“We face an attack on our democracy and truth, a raging virus, growing inequity, the sting of systemic racism, a climate in crisis, America’s role in the world,” Biden said.
“Any one of the these would be enough to challenge us in profound ways. But the fact is, we face them all at once, presenting this nation with one of the gravest responsibilities we’ve had,” Biden said.
Biden is expected to head to the White House, where he will sign a flurry of executive orders, including halting construction of Trump’s border wall and reversing the travel ban that targets predominantly Muslim countries.

snippet.title: 3 Days that Stopped the World | Al Jazeera Investigations
snippet.description:
Mid January, 2020. Two Chinese journalists were sent to Wuhan to investigate a mysterious virus outbreak. This is their account of the three days before Wuhan entered lockdown. The World Health Organization held meetings to decide if the epidemic was a global health emergency. It did not consider it so. When the journalists arrive, locals were busy preparing for upcoming Chinese New Year celebration. At the time, not much was known about the virus that was just days away from changing the world. Then came a pivotal announcement: human-to-human transmission was confirmed. The journalists witnessed a city of 11 million people transform overnight. Initial nonchalance was quickly replaced by panic. People started wearing masks, shops were shuttered. They shuttled between the increasingly saturated hospitals and Huanan Seafood Market, at the time thought to be the epicentre of this contagion. And they were stopped at every juncture. Their reports were censored and their investigations blocked. @AJIUnit

snippet.title: Uganda Decides: Museveni or Bobi Wine? | The Stream
snippet.description:
Ugandans head to the polls on January 14 to vote in a presidential election after a campaign that has been marred by violence.  
 
Though there are at least 10 candidates, the frontrunners are longtime incumbent Yoweri Museveni, youthful pretender Robert Kyagulanyi and Forum for Democratic Change leader Patrick Amuriat. 

Both Kyagulanyi (a popstar who is more popularly know by his stage name Bobi Wine) and Amuriat have been subjected to violence from security forces while on the campaign trail. Amuriat's car was allegedly shot at by a police officer on January 7 and he was arrested while campaigning on January 10.

Wine, thought to be Museveni's strongest challenger, has been arrested and wounded several times during the campaign and one of his bodyguards was killed after being run over by a military vehicle in December. 
 
Wine briefly suspended his campaign after members of his team were wounded following clashes between his supporters and security forces. Wine has filed a formal complaint with the International Criminal Court asking that Museveni and other high-ranking government officials be investigated for human rights violations. 
 
On this episode of The Stream we are joined by Wine spokesman Joel Ssenyonyi and government spokesman Ofwono Opondo to discuss Uganda’s future and who should lead the country into it.

snippet.title: Who's right: Facebook or Apple? | Inside Story
snippet.description:
The world's richest companies are going head to head in a very public argument, one which effects both their bottom lines. It's all about profits.
In one corner, there's Apple, not only the most dominant company in tech, but the highest valued business in the world.
Its devices are in the hands of more than a billion people.
In the other corner, Facebook. Its social media platform is used around the globe by close to three billion people.
That reach gives it an extremly commanding hold on online advertising.
And that's the problem.
So, who will win in the end?

Presenter: Peter Dobbie

Guests
Jim Anderson, C-E-O of Social Flow, a company that helps media organizations distribute its social content online.
Joanna Bryson, Professor of Technology and Ethics at the Hertie School for Governance.
Marc Owen Jones, professor who specializes in social media and the digital humanities at Hamad Bin Khalifa University.

snippet.title: US COVID-19 vaccine programme head optimistic as shipping begins
snippet.description:
The first shipments of the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine are arriving at distribution centres across the United States under Operation Warp Speed - the nation's largest immunisation project in history.
Under the programme, officials are hoping to distribute 40 million doses this month and immunise as many as 100 million by the first quarter of 2021. 
The coronavirus pandemic has killed nearly 300,000 Americans - more than anywhere else in the world.

Al Jazeera’s John Hendren reports from Washington, DC, the US.

snippet.title: James Swan: Has the UN failed Somalia? | Talk to Al Jazeera
snippet.description:
The United Nations has played a central role in efforts for peace in Somalia since the downfall of President Siad Barre in 1991 prompted political chaos across the Horn of Africa.

But almost 30 years on, the Somali people still live in turmoil, hundreds of thousands have been killed and millions displaced.

As multiple parties continue to fight over control of the country, many consider Somalia to be the UN’s greatest diplomatic failure.

Will Somalia ever achieve peace?

James Swan, the special representative of the UN secretary-general and head of the UN Assistance Mission in Somalia (UNSOM), talks to Al Jazeera.

snippet.title: Is China a threat or a partner to the West? | Head to Head
snippet.description:
Since the outbreak of COVID-19, tensions have mounted between China and the United States.

In this special edition of Head to Head, we ask if the West is heading towards a new Cold War with China.

In part one, we challenge retired US Brigadier General Robert Spalding, a former senior director for strategy on President Donald Trump's National Security Council, on why he believes the world should stand forcefully against China.

In part two, we challenge Kerry Brown, director of the Lau China Institute, King's College London, who argues that it would be disastrous to turn away from China now.

More: https://www.aljazeera.com/programmes/headtohead/

snippet.title: US healthcare: A cure worse than disease? | Head to Head
snippet.description:
In this episode, Mehdi Hasan goes Head to Head with two guests with opposing views.

In part one, he challenges Lanhee Chen, chief architect of former Republican presidential candidate Mitt Romney's campaign. Chen argues that "the employer-sponsored system ... has been the linchpin of a quality system of care we have in the US".

And in part two, Hasan debates Bernie Sanders surrogate and health policy expert Abdul El-Sayed. "I don't want to live in a society where any of my neighbours … have to potentially go bankrupt because they got sick ... and that's what we have here in the United States," he says.

*Editors Note: In the programme, Hasan refers to a study by the Kaiser Family Foundation, published May 13, which estimated that by May 2, 2020, some 27 million Americans could have lost their health insurance as a result of the economic impact of the coronavirus. After this segment was recorded, a new study, conducted by Families USA, estimated that 5.4 million Americans lost their health insurance. While the Kaiser study took into account family members of the insured, the Families USA study did not. Americans frequently receive their insurance through another family member's employer.

More: https://www.aljazeera.com/programmes/headtohead/

snippet.title: US coronavirus catastrophe: Who is to blame? | Head to Head
snippet.description:
With more than 146,000 deaths and counting, the United States has been the hardest hit country by COVID-19.

In this first episode of a special Head to Head series, we challenge prominent members of the Republican and Democratic parties on their handling of the crisis.

In part one, Mehdi Hasan challenges Jack Kingston, a surrogate for the Donald Trump campaign, and a former Republican congressman.

Our second guest, Jess O'Connell, is the former CEO of the Democratic National Committee who has worked on Hillary Clinton and Pete Buttigieg's presidential campaigns.

So, who is to blame for the US COVID-19 catastrophe?

*Editor's Note: These interviews were recorded on July 9 and 13, and since then, some of the data quoted has changed, including the number of cases and the death toll, which have sadly grown exponentially.

snippet.title: Saudi Women: Reform or Repression? | Al Jazeera World
snippet.description:
Just how free are women in Saudi Arabia today? The Saudi government has said it supports the empowerment of women and young people. While there have been reforms, including lifting the ban on women driving in June 2018, the arrest and detention of women speaking out against the government appear to have continued.

Al Jazeera World looks at the individual cases of five Saudi women currently in detention, or who have fled the country following apparent harassment for their political views. It asks whether Saudi Arabia is publicly championing the rights of women while privately punishing those who challenge the status quo.

In this film, the family of one detainee makes serious allegations of torture during her imprisonment, while others give testimonies about random arrests and arbitrary detention at Dhahban prison near Jeddah. According to Human Rights Watch, and following international pressure, the Saudi Human Rights Commission carried out an investigation into conditions at Dhahban and found no evidence of torture.

This film examines the consequences of activism in Saudi Arabia, hearing from women detainees and international human rights organisations, as well as seeking responses from those at the heart of decision-making within the country.

localized.description:
Just how free are women in Saudi Arabia today? The Saudi government has said it supports the empowerment of women and young people. While there have been reforms, including lifting the ban on women driving in June 2018, the arrest and detention of women speaking out against the government appear to have continued.

Al Jazeera World looks at the individual cases of five Saudi women currently in detention, or who have fled the country following apparent harassment for their political views. It asks whether Saudi Arabia is publicly championing the rights of women while privately punishing those who challenge the status quo.

In this film, the family of one detainee makes serious allegations of torture during her imprisonment, while others give testimonies about random arrests and arbitrary detention at Dhahban prison near Jeddah. According to Human Rights Watch, and following international pressure, the Saudi Human Rights Commission carried out an investigation into conditions at Dhahban and found no evidence of torture.

This film examines the consequences of activism in Saudi Arabia, hearing from women detainees and international human rights organisations, as well as seeking responses from those at the heart of decision-making within the country.

snippet.title: WHO head says he will keep leading virus fight after Trump threat
snippet.description:
US President Donald Trump has called Speaker of the House of Representatives Nancy Pelosi "sick" after she criticised him because he threatened to withhold funding from the World Health Organization.

Al Jazeera’s Mike Hanna reports from Washington, DC, US.

snippet.title: 'Nothing left': Venezuelans head home amid coronavirus pandemic
snippet.description:
As the coronavirus outbreak worsens in Latin America, Colombia has extended its nationwide quarantine for a further two weeks until April 27. 
That means many people cannot get to work, including the Venezuelan migrants who fled to Colombia and elsewhere because of the economic crisis in their country.
Now hundreds of them, bereft of work, are heading home. 

Al Jazeera’s Lucia Newman reports.

Nearly 800 Italians died from the new coronavirus on Saturday. 
Al Jazeera's Ed Augustin reports from Havana.

snippet.title: Lesbos migrant crisis: Thousands trying to reach Greek island
snippet.description:
Greece has reinforced its sea and land borders to stop migrants crossing over after Turkey made good on its threat to allow refugees on its soil to head to Europe. 
The Greek government says that it would suspend new asylum claims for a month.
Turkey is trying to pressure the European Union for help with its military operations in Syria. 
Al Jazeera's John Psarapolous reports from the Greek Island of Lesbos.

snippet.title: Is Bollywood complicit in pushing Modi's right-wing agenda? | UpFront
snippet.description:
The mainstreaming of a hardline brand of Hindu nationalism, mob lynchings, attacks on students, and an escalation in hate crimes: These have all become features of India under the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

However, most celebrities have been reluctant to speak out against the prime minister's politics. Bollywood songwriter and poet Javed Akhtar is one of the few who is raising his voice.

He believes Modi is a fascist.

"Of course he is, I mean fascists don't have horns on their head," Akhtar said. "The moment you hate people in wholesale, you're a fascist," he added.

Bollywood director and producer Mahesh Bhatt says Muslims and other minorities in India have never felt more insecure and believes the media has played a key role in fueling anti-Muslim sentiment.

"I mean, that kind of a fear has been crafted, been structured day in and day out ... the pliable channels are working around the clock to create, the 'other'," he said.

But when it comes to Bollywood and Modi, many stars appear to support the prime minister, or at least refuse to criticise him. Bhatt says that fear is to blame.

"They feel very vulnerable, but the explosive silence speaks for itself, that these people are frightened to speak their minds, even if they feel completely different to what they are posturing privately," he said.

Akhtar agrees that people are scared to speak out, but he also says that the influence Bollywood has is highly exaggerated.

"Theatre or cinema's influence is highly exaggerated. No country can claim that a revolution or a great social change came into that society because of a film," Akhtar said.

Bhatt said if books or films could change a nation, India would have become a paradise by now.

"On the ground, I think there are other more serious things which ultimately decide which particular party will rule us. And filmmakers or actors and actresses ... have a very limited role to play in creating the atmospherics," Bhatt said.

On this week's UpFront, Bollywood heavyweights Mahesh Bhatt and Javed Akhtar discuss the film industry's role in speaking out against hardline Hindu nationalism in Modi's India.

Follow UpFront on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AJUpFront and Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/AJUpFront/

snippet.title: US sends asylum seekers to Guatemala as new caravan heads north
snippet.description:
More than 2,700 people have entered Guatemala in a fast-growing caravan heading for the United States.
Most are escaping extreme poverty and gang violence in Honduras.
But it is unlikely they will ever step on US soil.

Al Jazeera's John Holman reports from Guatemala City.

snippet.title: India protester shot in head driving outrage at police
snippet.description:
In India, the family of a young man shot in the head during a protest says he was intentionally killed by police.
He is one of at least 25 people killed since demonstrations began against the government's new citizenship law.
Police are blaming protesters who they say were carrying illegal firearms. But activists say their investigation shows otherwise.
Al Jazeera's Anchal Vohra reports from the northern state of Uttar Pradesh, where most of the deaths have taken place.

ko.title: 경찰에 분노를 몰고 머리에 총 인도 시위
ko.description:
인도에서는 시위 도중 머리에 총을 맞은 젊은이의 가족이 의도적으로 경찰에 의해 살해 당했다고한다.
그는 정부의 새로운 시민법에 반대하는 시위가 시작된 이래 25 명 이상의 사망자 중 한 명입니다.
경찰은 불법 총기를 소지했다고 시위대를 비난하고 있습니다. 그러나 운동가들은 그들의 조사가 다르게 보인다고 말합니다.
Al Jazeera의 Anchal Vohra는 대부분의 사망이 발생한 우타르 프라데시 주 북부 지역에서 보도했다.

zh.title: 印度抗议者开枪对警察头部暴怒
zh.description:

自示威游行开始违反政府的新公民法以来，他是被杀害的至少25人之一。
警察指责抗议者他们说携带非法枪支。 但是活动人士说，他们的调查表明情况并非如此。
半岛电视台的《安卡拉·沃赫拉》报道了北方邦北方邦（Uttar Pradesh）的大部分死亡事件。

ms.title: Penunjuk perasaan India ditembak di kepala kemarahan memandu di polis
ms.description:
Di India, keluarga seorang lelaki muda yang ditembak di kepala semasa bantahan mengatakan bahawa dia sengaja dibunuh oleh polis.
Dia adalah sekurang-kurangnya 25 orang yang terbunuh sejak demonstrasi bermula dengan undang-undang kewarganegaraan baru kerajaan.
Polis menyalahkan penunjuk perasaan yang dikatakan membawa senjata api haram. Tetapi aktivis mengatakan siasatan mereka menunjukkan sebaliknya.
Laporan Anchal Vohra dari Al Jazeera dari negeri utara Uttar Pradesh, di mana kebanyakan kematian telah berlaku.

hi.title: इंडिया प्रोटेस्टर ने पुलिस पर हेड ड्राइविंग में गोली मारी
hi.description:
भारत में, एक युवक के परिवार ने विरोध के दौरान सिर में गोली मार दी, उनका कहना है कि उन्हें जानबूझकर पुलिस द्वारा मार दिया गया था।
वह सरकार के नए नागरिकता कानून के खिलाफ प्रदर्शन शुरू होने के बाद कम से कम 25 लोगों की हत्या में से एक है।
पुलिस प्रदर्शनकारियों को दोषी ठहरा रही है जो कहते हैं कि वे अवैध आग्नेयास्त्र ले जा रहे थे। लेकिन कार्यकर्ताओं का कहना है कि उनकी जाँच से पता चलता है।
अल जज़ीरा की आंचल वोहरा उत्तरी राज्य उत्तर प्रदेश से रिपोर्ट करती हैं, जहाँ सबसे ज्यादा मौतें हुई हैं।

tr.title: Hindistan protestocu kafasından polis öfke sürüş vurdu
tr.description:
Hindistan'da bir protesto sırasında kafasından vurulan genç bir adamın ailesi, kasıtlı olarak polis tarafından öldürüldüğünü söylüyor.
Hükümetin yeni vatandaşlık yasasına karşı gösteriler başlatıldığından beri en az 25 kişiden biri.
Polis, yasadışı ateşli silah taşıdığını söylediği protestocuları suçluyor. Ancak aktivistler soruşturmalarının aksini gösterdiğini söylüyorlar.
Al Jazeera'dan Anchal Vohra, ölümlerin çoğunun gerçekleştiği kuzey Uttar Pradesh eyaletinden raporlar.

ar.title: الهند متظاهر بالرصاص في غضب القيادة على الشرطة
ar.description:
في الهند ، تقول عائلة الشاب الذي أصيب برصاصة في رأسه أثناء احتجاج إنه قُتل عمداً على أيدي الشرطة.
إنه واحد من 25 شخصًا على الأقل قتلوا منذ بدء المظاهرات ضد قانون الجنسية الجديد للحكومة.
تلوم الشرطة المتظاهرين الذين يقولون إنهم كانوا يحملون أسلحة نارية غير قانونية. لكن الناشطين يقولون إن تحقيقهم يظهر خلاف ذلك.
تقارير Anchal Vohra من الجزيرة من ولاية أوتار براديش الشمالية ، حيث وقعت معظم الوفيات.

snippet.title: Head of UN-recognised gov't in Libya asks world leaders for help
snippet.description:
The United Nations-recognised Government of National Accord is calling on the International Criminal Court to take action against renegade military commander Khalifa Haftar. It says his crimes against humanity must be stopped.
Hundreds of civilians have been killed or wounded since the beginning of the offensive in April.

Al Jazeera's Mahmoud Abdelwahed reports from Tripoli.

ms.title: Ketua pemerintah yang diakui PBB di Libya meminta pemimpin dunia untuk bantuan
ms.description:
Kerajaan yang diiktiraf oleh Pertubuhan Bangsa-Bangsa Bersatu menyeru Mahkamah Jenayah Antarabangsa untuk mengambil tindakan terhadap komander tentera pemberontak Khalifa Haftar. Ia mengatakan kejahatannya terhadap umat manusia mesti dihentikan.

hi.title: लीबिया में संयुक्त राष्ट्र द्वारा मान्यता प्राप्त गणतंत्र के प्रमुख ने दुनिया के नेताओं से मदद मांगी
hi.description:
संयुक्त राष्ट्र की मान्यता प्राप्त सरकार नेशनल एकॉर्ड ने अंतर्राष्ट्रीय आपराधिक न्यायालय से आह्वान किया है कि वह पाखण्डी सैन्य कमांडर खलीफा हफर के खिलाफ कार्रवाई करे। इसमें कहा गया है कि मानवता के खिलाफ उसके अपराधों को रोकना चाहिए।
अप्रैल में आक्रामक की शुरुआत के बाद से सैकड़ों नागरिक मारे गए हैं या घायल हुए हैं।

अल जज़ीरा के महमूद अब्देलवाह ने त्रिपोली से रिपोर्ट की।

fr.title: Le chef du gouvernement reconnu par l'ONU en Libye demande de l'aide aux dirigeants mondiaux
fr.description:
Le gouvernement d'accord national reconnu par les Nations Unies demande à la Cour pénale internationale de prendre des mesures contre le commandant militaire renégat Khalifa Haftar. Il dit que ses crimes contre l'humanité doivent être arrêtés.
Des centaines de civils ont été tués ou blessés depuis le début de l'offensive en avril.

tr.title: BM tarafından tanınan Libya'daki başkan, dünya liderlerinden yardım istiyor
tr.description:
Birleşmiş Milletler tarafından tanınan Ulusal Anlaşma Hükümeti, Uluslararası Ceza Mahkemesi'ni askeri askeri komutan Khalifa Haftar'a karşı harekete geçmeye çağırıyor. İnsanlığa karşı işlediği suçların durdurulması gerektiğini söylüyor.
Nisan ayında saldırının başlamasından bu yana yüzlerce sivil öldürüldü ya da yaralandı.

El Cezire'den Mahmud Abdelwahed Trablus'tan raporlar.

snippet.title: Tackle ban: American football head injuries under review
snippet.description:
Some legislators in the United States want to change the way children play American football, to make it safer.
The state of New York is the latest to consider amending rules, in an attempt to reduce head injuries.
But, even with a new study highlighting the risks of the game, there is resistance.
 Al Jazeera's Kristen Saloomey reports from Bridgewater, New Jersey.

Wabunge wengine huko Merika wanataka kubadilisha njia watoto wanapocheza mpira wa Amerika, kuifanya iwe salama.
Hali ya New York ni ya hivi karibuni kuzingatia sheria za kurekebisha, katika jaribio la kupunguza jeraha la kichwa.
Lakini, hata na uchunguzi mpya unaonyesha hatari za mchezo huo, kuna upinzani.

Negeri New York adalah yang terbaru untuk mempertimbangkan aturan-aturan amandemen, dalam usaha untuk mengurangi kecederaan kepala.

ar.title: حظر المعالجة: إصابات رأس كرة القدم الأمريكية قيد المراجعة
ar.description:
يريد بعض المشرعين في الولايات المتحدة تغيير طريقة لعب الأطفال لكرة القدم الأمريكية ، لجعلها أكثر أمانًا.
ولاية نيويورك هي الأحدث التي تدرس تعديل القواعد ، في محاولة للحد من إصابات الرأس.
لكن حتى مع وجود دراسة جديدة تسلط الضوء على مخاطر اللعبة ، فهناك مقاومة.
  تقارير كريستين سالومي من قناة الجزيرة من بريدجووتر ، نيو جيرسي.

fr.title: Interdiction du tacle: les blessures à la tête dans le football américain sont à l'étude
fr.description:
Aux États-Unis, certains législateurs veulent changer la façon dont les enfants jouent au football américain, pour le rendre plus sûr.
L'État de New York est le dernier à avoir envisagé de modifier les règles afin de réduire les traumatismes crâniens.
Mais, même avec une nouvelle étude mettant en évidence les risques du jeu, il y a de la résistance.
  Kristen Saloomey d'Al Jazeera rapporte de Bridgewater, New Jersey.

es.description:
Algunos legisladores en los Estados Unidos quieren cambiar la forma en que los niños juegan fútbol americano, para hacerlo más seguro.
El estado de Nueva York es el último en considerar la modificación de las reglas, en un intento por reducir las lesiones en la cabeza.

hi.description:
संयुक्त राज्य में कुछ विधायक बच्चों को अमेरिकी फुटबॉल खेलने के तरीके को बदलना चाहते हैं, ताकि इसे सुरक्षित बनाया जा सके।
सिर की चोटों को कम करने के प्रयास में, न्यूयॉर्क राज्य, संशोधित नियमों पर विचार करने के लिए नवीनतम है।
लेकिन, खेल के जोखिमों को उजागर करने वाले एक नए अध्ययन के साथ भी प्रतिरोध है।

snippet.title: Hong Kong and the Uighurs: How far will China go? | UpFront (Full)
snippet.description:
In this episode of UpFront, we ask Beijing-based commentator Victor Gao about the protests in Hong Kong and challenge him on China's mass detention of Uighur Muslims in Xinjiang.

And in our Arena, Omar Shakir and Eugene Kontorovich debate the US policy reversal on illegal Israeli settlements in the occupied West Bank.

Hong Kong protests: Are police using excessive force?
The US ramped up the pressure on Hong Kong this week over its handling of anti-government protests that have dragged on for months in the self-governing Chinese territory.

Congress passed two bills aimed at supporting protesters; they include measures that would allow for sanctions against officials responsible for human rights abuses in Hong Kong. The move infuriated China, which warned of "strong countermeasures" if US President Donald Trump signed off on the bill.

The protests, which began in June, have become progressively violent. The UN human rights office said it was concerned that some demonstrators were resorting to extreme violence, but it has also questioned the use of excessive police force.

Human Rights Watch and Amnesty International have also raised concerns over police handling of the crisis.

Victor Gao, vice president of the Center for China and Globalization, says Hong Kong protects the right of people to protest, but that there are criminals among the demonstrators.

"They [the police] have a job to do, they need to do whatever they can, allowed by the law, to bring law and order back to Hong Kong," Gao said.

"Hong Kong police compared with their counterparts in many other cities in the world are very well disciplined, very civilised, if I may use that word. And I don't think they use excessive force," he added.

When asked about China's actions in Xinjiang province, where it is believed up to three million Uighur Muslims have been imprisoned in so-called "reeducation camps" Gao said he supports the government's measures.

"I support all the legal measures adopted by the Chinese Government under Chinese law, in order to fight against terrorism," Gao said.

Rights groups say China is conducting a mass, systematic campaign of human rights violations against Xinjiang's Muslims.

This week's Headliner is China commentator and former interpreter to President Deng Xiaoping, Victor Gao.

US policy on Israeli settlements: What's the legal basis?
US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo announced this week that the US no longer considers settlements in the occupied West Bank illegal, reversing 40 years of American policy.

Pompeo said the decision was made after "carefully studying all sides of the legal debate".

According to several United Nations Security Council resolutions, the most recent in 2016, Israeli settlements are illegal under international law as they violate the Fourth Geneva Convention, which prohibits an occupying power from transferring its population to the area it occupies.

Omar Shakir, director of Human Rights Watch in Israel and Palestine, says the Trump administration cannot erase decades of established international law.

"There is consensus outside of this Israeli government, and outside of the Trump administration, that settlements are illegal. It is as uncontroversial to say settlements are illegal as it is to say that torture is illegal. It is black-and-white international law," Shakir said.

Eugene Kontorovich, an international law professor at George Mason University Scalia Law School and the Israeli think-tank Kohelet Policy Forum, says settlements are not illegal because you can only occupy the territory of another country.

"In 1967, when Israel retook the West Bank, it was not Jordanian territory. Jordan was not the sovereign. It was not - there was no Palestinian state, it's not occupation," Kontorovich said.

In this week's Arena, we discuss the US policy reversal on Israeli settlements in the occupied West Bank.

en.title: Hong Kong and the Uighurs: How far will China go? | UpFront (Full)
en.description:
In this episode of UpFront, we ask Beijing-based commentator Victor Gao about the protests in Hong Kong and challenge him on China's mass detention of Uighur Muslims in Xinjiang.

And in our Arena, Omar Shakir and Eugene Kontorovich debate the US policy reversal on illegal Israeli settlements in the occupied West Bank.

Hong Kong protests: Are police using excessive force?
The US ramped up the pressure on Hong Kong this week over its handling of anti-government protests that have dragged on for months in the self-governing Chinese territory.

Congress passed two bills aimed at supporting protesters; they include measures that would allow for sanctions against officials responsible for human rights abuses in Hong Kong. The move infuriated China, which warned of "strong countermeasures" if US President Donald Trump signed off on the bill.

The protests, which began in June, have become progressively violent. The UN human rights office said it was concerned that some demonstrators were resorting to extreme violence, but it has also questioned the use of excessive police force.

Human Rights Watch and Amnesty International have also raised concerns over police handling of the crisis.

Victor Gao, vice president of the Center for China and Globalization, says Hong Kong protects the right of people to protest, but that there are criminals among the demonstrators.

"They [the police] have a job to do, they need to do whatever they can, allowed by the law, to bring law and order back to Hong Kong," Gao said.

"Hong Kong police compared with their counterparts in many other cities in the world are very well disciplined, very civilised, if I may use that word. And I don't think they use excessive force," he added.

When asked about China's actions in Xinjiang province, where it is believed up to three million Uighur Muslims have been imprisoned in so-called "reeducation camps" Gao said he supports the government's measures.

"I support all the legal measures adopted by the Chinese Government under Chinese law, in order to fight against terrorism," Gao said.

Rights groups say China is conducting a mass, systematic campaign of human rights violations against Xinjiang's Muslims.

This week's Headliner is China commentator and former interpreter to President Deng Xiaoping, Victor Gao.

US policy on Israeli settlements: What's the legal basis?
US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo announced this week that the US no longer considers settlements in the occupied West Bank illegal, reversing 40 years of American policy.

Pompeo said the decision was made after "carefully studying all sides of the legal debate".

According to several United Nations Security Council resolutions, the most recent in 2016, Israeli settlements are illegal under international law as they violate the Fourth Geneva Convention, which prohibits an occupying power from transferring its population to the area it occupies.

Omar Shakir, director of Human Rights Watch in Israel and Palestine, says the Trump administration cannot erase decades of established international law.

"There is consensus outside of this Israeli government, and outside of the Trump administration, that settlements are illegal. It is as uncontroversial to say settlements are illegal as it is to say that torture is illegal. It is black-and-white international law," Shakir said.

Eugene Kontorovich, an international law professor at George Mason University Scalia Law School and the Israeli think-tank Kohelet Policy Forum, says settlements are not illegal because you can only occupy the territory of another country.

"In 1967, when Israel retook the West Bank, it was not Jordanian territory. Jordan was not the sovereign. It was not - there was no Palestinian state, it's not occupation," Kontorovich said.

In this week's Arena, we discuss the US policy reversal on Israeli settlements in the occupied West Bank.

snippet.title: Islamophobia in Europe: Why won't Poland take in any Muslims? | UpFront
snippet.description:
In this episode of UpFront, we ask Polish politician Dominik Tarczynski about his government's immigration policy and anti-Muslim rhetoric.

And in our Arena, Rim-Sarah Alouane and Benjamin Haddad discuss what's behind the ongoing debate over secularism in France.

Polish MP: 'For me, multiculturalism is not a value'
Poland's ultra-conservative Law and Justice Party (PiS) won a second term in office last month, a victory that critics fear will accelerate the country's slide towards authoritarianism.

The PiS rose to power in 2015, following a campaign that focussed on social conservatism, along with a generous social spending programme.

But the party's refusal to take in refugees, along with its attempts to reform the judiciary - critics say at the expense of independence - has put it at loggerheads with the European Union.

Just this week a top EU legal adviser said Warsaw broke the bloc’s law by refusing to take in refugees during Europe's 2015 migrant crisis.

But the PiS's Domink Tarczynski insists his country did nothing wrong, and says Poland stands by its immigration policy.

"We don't want Poland being taken over by Muslims, Buddhists, or someone else ... and no one will ever force us to take Muslims, Buddhists, non-believers in huge numbers," said Tarczynski.

Tarczynski says after living in the UK and the US and experiencing life in a multicultural society, he doesn't see any value in it.

"For me, multicultural society, it's not a value … it's not a virtue," the Polish MP said. "Christian culture, Roman law, Greek philosophers, these are the virtues for us."

This week's Headliner is member of parliament for Poland's governing Law and Justice Party, Dominik Tarczynski.

France, secularism and hijab paranoia
The debate over Muslim women wearing the veil has been reignited in France, after a mother was verbally abused last month by a far-right politican during her son's school trip to a regional assembly. The politician demanded the woman remove her headscarf or leave.

Wearing the veil - known as the hijab - is banned in French schools and government offices.

Politicians are now examining a proposed law that would ban parents from wearing religious symbols by parents on school trips.

The legislation has little chance of passing, but it has put the issue of French secularism, embodied in the principle of 'laicite', firmly back in the spotlight.

Critics see a worrying trend where 'laicite' could enter more areas of French society.

"We are witnessing a transformation of 'laicite' into a legal monster that it was not aimed to be when the law was implemented," said human rights researcher Rim-Sarah Alouane, who focuses on religious freedom and civil liberties.

"We have religious freedom at stake, but also constant harassment and targeting of a part of our population," she added.

Benjamin Haddad, a director at the Atlantic Council, says the law does target Muslims, and agrees it should not be extended, but he says it should be acceptable to have a political debate about what some see as problems with integration.

"You have a lot of secular Muslim women who say that they feel pressured, they feel threatened ... you also have religious leaders going to mayors asking to have separate hours in public swimming pools between men and women. You'll have a lot of young girls who don't want to sit in biology classes in school because they feel pressure from their parents or from their brothers," Haddad said.

"That makes it very complicated for young women and other groups such as LGBTs to express themselves," he added.

In this week's Arena, we discuss secularism in France and its impact on religious freedom.

hi.title: यूरोप में इस्लामोफोबिया: पोलैंड किसी भी मुसलमानों में क्यों नहीं लगेगा? | अग्रिम
hi.description:
अपफ्रंट के इस एपिसोड में, हम पोलिश राजनेता डॉमिनिक तारकसेंस्की से उनकी सरकार की आव्रजन नीति और मुस्लिम विरोधी बयानबाजी के बारे में पूछते हैं।

और हमारे एरिना में, रिम-सारा अलौने और बेंजामिन हद्दाद चर्चा करते हैं कि फ्रांस में धर्मनिरपेक्षता पर चल रही बहस के पीछे क्या है।

In unserer Arena diskutieren Rim-Sarah Alouane und Benjamin Haddad darüber, was hinter der anhaltenden Debatte über den Säkularismus in Frankreich steckt.

snippet.title: South Africa's first black rugby head inspires destitute players
snippet.description:
South Africa's title win at the 2019 Rugby World Cup was not just a sporting success story.
For the first time, the trophy was lifted by a black captain, Siya Kolisi, who fought his way from humble beginnings to lead his country to rugby's biggest prize.

Al Jazeera's Fahmida Miller reports from Kolisi’s home town Zwide in the Eastern Cape province where there are few resources for young players.

ms.title: Kepala ragbi hitam Afrika Selatan yang pertama memberi inspirasi kepada pemain yang miskin
ms.description:
Kemenangan Afrika Selatan pada Piala Dunia Ragbi 2019 bukan sekadar cerita kejayaan sukan.
Buat pertama kalinya, trofi itu ditarik oleh kapten hitam, Dia Kolisi, yang melancarkan jalannya dari awal yang rendah untuk memimpin negaranya untuk hadiah terbesar ragbi.

Laporan Fahmida Miller dari Al Jazeera dari bandar besar Kolisi Zwide di wilayah Cape Timur di mana terdapat sedikit sumber untuk pemain muda.

af.title: Suid-Afrika se eerste swart rugbyhoof inspireer behoeftige spelers
af.description:
Suid-Afrika se titeloorwinning by die Rugbywêreldbeker in 2019 was nie net 'n sportverhaal nie.
Die trofee word vir die eerste keer opgehef deur 'n swart kaptein, Siya Kolisi, wat van nederige begin af weggeveg het om sy land na die grootste prys van rugby te lei.

Al Jazeera se Fahmida Miller berig van Kolisi se tuisdorp Zwide in die provinsie Oos-Kaap waar daar min hulpbronne vir jong spelers is.

ar.title: أول رئيس أسود للرجبي في جنوب إفريقيا يلهم اللاعبين المعوزين
ar.description:
لم يكن الفوز بلقب جنوب أفريقيا في كأس العالم للرجبي لعام 2019 مجرد قصة نجاح رياضية.
لأول مرة ، تم رفع الكأس من قبل كابتن أسود ، سيا كوليسي ، الذي حارب من بداياته المتواضعة لقيادة بلاده إلى أكبر جائزة في لعبة الركبي.

فهميدا ميلر من قناة الجزيرة تقدم تقارير من مسقط رأس كوليسي Zwide في مقاطعة الكاب الشرقية حيث توجد موارد قليلة للاعبين الشباب.

es.title: La primera cabeza de rugby negro de Sudáfrica inspira a jugadores indigentes
es.description:
La victoria por el título de Sudáfrica en la Copa Mundial de Rugby 2019 no fue solo una historia de éxito deportivo.
Por primera vez, el trofeo fue levantado por un capitán negro, Siya Kolisi, quien se abrió camino desde humildes comienzos para llevar a su país al mayor premio de rugby.

Fahmida Miller de Al Jazeera informa desde la ciudad natal de Kolisi, Zwide, en la provincia del Cabo Oriental, donde hay pocos recursos para jugadores jóvenes.

tr.description:
Güney Afrika'nın 2019 Rugby Dünya Kupası'nda kazandığı şampiyonluk sadece sportif bir başarı öyküsü değildi.
İlk defa, kupa mütevazi bir başlangıçtan ülkesini rugby'nin en büyük ödülüne götürmek için mücadele eden siyahi bir kaptan Siya Kolisi tarafından kaldırıldı.

El Cezire’nin Fahmida Miller’ı, Kolisi’nin Doğu Cape eyaletindeki Zwide kentindeki genç oyuncuların çok az kaynağının bulunduğunu bildirdi.

hi.title: दक्षिण अफ्रीका का पहला काला रग्बी सिर निराश्रित खिलाड़ियों को प्रेरित करता है
hi.description:
2019 रग्बी विश्व कप में दक्षिण अफ्रीका की खिताबी जीत सिर्फ एक खेल की सफलता की कहानी नहीं थी।
पहली बार, ट्रॉफी एक काले कप्तान, सिया कोलीसी द्वारा ली गई, जिसने अपने देश को रग्बी के सबसे बड़े पुरस्कार के लिए नेतृत्व करने के लिए विनम्र शुरुआत से अपना रास्ता दिखाया।

अल जज़ीरा के फहमीदा मिलर ने पूर्वी केप प्रांत में कोलीसी के गृह शहर ज़ील्ड से रिपोर्ट की जहां युवा खिलाड़ियों के लिए कुछ संसाधन हैं।

fr.description:
La victoire du titre de l'Afrique du Sud à la Coupe du monde de rugby 2019 n'était pas seulement une réussite sportive.
Pour la première fois, le trophée a été levé par un capitaine noir, Siya Kolisi, qui a connu des débuts modestes et qui a mené son pays au plus grand prix du rugby.

Fahmida Miller (Al Jazeera) rapporte dans la ville de Kolisi, Zwide, dans la province du Cap-Oriental, où les ressources sont limitées pour les jeunes joueurs.

snippet.title: Colombia local elections: Voters head to polls on Sunday
snippet.description:
Colombians will head to the polls on Sunday for local elections largely seen as a referendum on the government of Ivan Duque, one year into his presidency. 
But they are also testing Colombia's political environment after the signing of a peace deal with FARC rebels in 2016.
New civil society movements are gaining traction in regions once at the centre of the conflict. 
Al Jazeera's Alessandro Rampietti reports from Buenaventura, on the Colombian Pacific coast.

es.title: Elecciones locales en Colombia: los votantes se dirigen a las elecciones el domingo
es.description:
Los colombianos acudirán a las urnas el domingo para las elecciones locales, en gran parte vistas como un referéndum sobre el gobierno de Ivan Duque, un año después de su presidencia.
Pero también están probando el entorno político de Colombia después de la firma de un acuerdo de paz con los rebeldes de las FARC en 2016.
Los nuevos movimientos de la sociedad civil están ganando terreno en regiones que alguna vez estuvieron en el centro del conflicto.
Alessandro Rampietti de Al Jazeera informa desde Buenaventura, en la costa del Pacífico colombiano.

Mas eles também estão testando o ambiente político da Colômbia após a assinatura de um acordo de paz com os rebeldes das FARC em 2016.

ur.title: کولمبیا کے بلدیاتی انتخابات: رائے دہندگان اتوار کو رائے شماری کا آغاز کر رہے ہیں
ur.description:
کولمبیا کے صدر اتوار کے روز بلدیاتی انتخابات کے لئے بڑے پیمانے پر انتخابات میں حصہ لیں گے جس میں بڑے پیمانے پر ایوان ڈوکی کی حکومت کے ریفرنڈم کے طور پر دیکھا جاتا ہے۔
لیکن وہ 2016 میں ایف اے آر سی باغیوں کے ساتھ امن معاہدے پر دستخط کرنے کے بعد کولمبیا کے سیاسی ماحول کی بھی جانچ کررہے ہیں۔
تنازعات کے مرکز میں ایک بار خطوں میں سول سوسائٹی کی نئی تحریکیں پھیلا رہی ہیں۔
کولمبیا کے بحر الکاہل کے ساحل پر ، بوئناونٹورا سے الجزیرہ کی الیسنڈررو رمپیٹی کی اطلاع ہے۔

fr.title: Elections locales en Colombie: les électeurs se rendront aux urnes dimanche
fr.description:
Les Colombiens se rendront aux urnes dimanche pour des élections locales, largement considérées comme un référendum sur le gouvernement d'Ivan Duque, un an après son entrée en fonction.
Mais ils testent également l'environnement politique colombien après la signature d'un accord de paix avec les rebelles des FARC en 2016.
De nouveaux mouvements de la société civile gagnent du terrain dans des régions autrefois au centre du conflit.
Alessandro Rampietti, de la chaîne Al Jazeera, a fait un reportage à Buenaventura, sur la côte pacifique colombienne.

کلمبیایی ها روز یکشنبه برای انتخابات محلی در نظرسنجی ها برای انتخابات محلی شرکت می کنند که عمدتا به عنوان همه پرسی در دولت ایوان دوکه ، یک سال از زمان ریاست جمهوری وی دیده می شود.
اما آنها همچنین پس از امضای توافق صلح با شورشیان FARC در سال 2016 ، محیط سیاسی کلمبیا را آزمایش می کنند.
جنبش های جدید جامعه مدنی در مناطق درگیری یک بار در منطقه درگیر می شوند.

tr.title: Kolombiya yerel seçimleri: Oy verenler Pazar günü sandık başına gidiyor
tr.description:
Kolombiyalılar, büyük olasılıkla bir yıl cumhurbaşkanlığına girecek olan Ivan Duque hükümeti üzerinde referandum olarak görülen yerel seçimler için Pazar günü sandık başına gidecekler.
Ancak, 2016'da FARC isyancılarıyla barış anlaşması imzalandıktan sonra Kolombiya'nın siyasi ortamını da test ediyorlar.

fr.description:

Et la dernière crise économique préoccupe les électeurs lors des élections générales de dimanche.

Les reportages de Teresa Bo d'Al Jazeera à Buenos Aires.

hi.title: कर्ज संकट के बीच अर्जेंटीना के मतदाता चुनावों के डर से
hi.description:
मुद्रास्फीति, अवमूल्यन और मंदी ऐसे शब्द हैं जिनका उपयोग अधिकांश अर्जेंटीना सुनवाई के लिए करते हैं।
और ताजा आर्थिक संकट रविवार के आम चुनाव में मतदाताओं के दिमाग पर है।

अल जज़ीरा के टेरेसा बो ने राजधानी ब्यूनस आयर्स से रिपोर्ट की।

es.title: Votantes argentinos se dirigirán a las encuestas en medio de temores de crisis
es.description:
La inflación, la devaluación y la recesión son palabras que la mayoría de los argentinos están acostumbrados a escuchar.
Y la última crisis económica está en la mente de los votantes en las elecciones generales del domingo.

ms.title: Pengundi Argentina mengetuai pemilihan di tengah-tengah ketakutan krisis hutang
ms.description:
Inflasi, penurunan nilai dan kemelesetan adalah kata-kata yang kebanyakan orang Argentina digunakan untuk mendengar.
Dan krisis ekonomi terkini adalah pada pemikiran para pengundi pada pilihan raya umum Ahad.

snippet.title: Hezbollah head says gov't fall could push Lebanon into 'chaos'
snippet.description:
There have been clashes between Hezbollah supporters and anti-government protesters in Beirut.
The scuffles prompted riot police to intervene - to try to defuse the situation.
Similar confrontations broke out on Thursday night at the same site in the centre of the city.
Hundreds of thousands of people have been demonstrating for the past nine days.
In a televised address, Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah said the fall of the government could lead to civil war.
 
Al Jazeera's Stefanie Dekker reports from Beirut.

tr.title: Hizbullah başkanı, sonbaharın düşmemesini Lübnan'ı 'kaosa' sürükleyebileceğini söyledi
tr.description:
Beyrut'ta Hizbullah destekçileri ile hükümet karşıtı protestocular arasında çatışmalar oldu.
Scuffles, çevik kuvvet polisinin müdahale etmesini sağladı - durumu etkisiz hale getirmeye çalıştı.
Benzer çatışmalar Perşembe gecesi şehir merkezinde aynı bölgede meydana geldi.
Son dokuz gündür yüz binlerce insan gösteri yapıyor.
Televizyonda yayınlanan bir konuşmada Hizbullah lideri Hasan Nasrallah, hükümetin çöküşünün iç savaşa yol açabileceğini söyledi.
 
El Cezire'nin Stefanie Dekker'i Beyrut'tan geliyor.

fr.title: Selon le président du Hezbollah, la chute du gouvernement pourrait pousser le Liban dans le "chaos"
fr.description:
Des affrontements ont eu lieu entre des partisans du Hezbollah et des manifestants antigouvernementaux à Beyrouth.
Les bagarres ont incité la police anti-émeute à intervenir pour tenter de désamorcer la situation.
Des affrontements similaires ont éclaté jeudi soir sur le même site, au centre-ville.
Des centaines de milliers de personnes ont manifesté au cours des neuf derniers jours.
Dans un discours télévisé, le dirigeant du Hezbollah, Hassan Nasrallah, a déclaré que la chute du gouvernement pourrait conduire à une guerre civile.
 
Stefanie Dekker d'Al Jazeera rapporte de Beyrouth.

ar.title: رئيس حزب الله يقول إن سقوط الحكومة قد يدفع لبنان إلى "الفوضى"
ar.description:
كانت هناك اشتباكات بين مؤيدي حزب الله والمتظاهرين المناهضين للحكومة في بيروت.
ودفعت المشاجرات شرطة مكافحة الشغب إلى التدخل - لمحاولة نزع فتيل الموقف.
اندلعت مواجهات مماثلة ليلة الخميس في نفس الموقع في وسط المدينة.
تظاهر مئات الآلاف من الناس خلال الأيام التسعة الماضية.
وفي خطاب متلفز ، قال زعيم حزب الله حسن نصر الله إن سقوط الحكومة قد يؤدي إلى حرب أهلية.
 
ستيفاني ديكر من قناة الجزيرة تقدم تقارير من بيروت.

es.title: El jefe de Hezbolá dice que la caída del gobierno podría empujar al Líbano al 'caos'
es.description:
Ha habido enfrentamientos entre los partidarios de Hezbolá y los manifestantes antigubernamentales en Beirut.
Los enfrentamientos provocaron que la policía antidisturbios interviniera para tratar de calmar la situación.
Enfrentamientos similares estallaron el jueves por la noche en el mismo sitio en el centro de la ciudad.
Cientos de miles de personas se han manifestado durante los últimos nueve días.
En un discurso televisado, el líder de Hezbolá, Hassan Nasrallah, dijo que la caída del gobierno podría llevar a una guerra civil.
 
Stefanie Dekker de Al Jazeera informa desde Beirut.

ms.title: Ketua Hizbullah mengatakan kejatuhan kerajaan boleh mendorong Lebanon menjadi 'huru-hara'
ms.description:
Terdapat pertembungan antara penyokong Hezbollah dan penunjuk perasaan anti-kerajaan di Beirut.
Keributan itu mendorong polis rusuhan untuk campur tangan - untuk cuba meredakan keadaan.
Konfrontasi yang sama berlaku pada malam Khamis di tapak yang sama di pusat bandar.
Beratus-ratus ribu orang telah menunjukkan untuk sembilan hari yang lalu.
Dalam sebuah alamat televisyen, pemimpin Hezbollah Hassan Nasrallah berkata kejatuhan kerajaan boleh membawa kepada perang saudara.
 
Laporan Al Jazeera Stefanie Dekker dari Beirut.

hi.title: हिजबुल्लाह प्रमुख का कहना है कि गिरना लेबनान को 'अराजकता' में धकेल सकता है
hi.description:
बेरूत में हिजबुल्ला समर्थकों और सरकार विरोधी प्रदर्शनकारियों के बीच झड़पें हुई हैं।
हाथापाई ने दंगा पुलिस को हस्तक्षेप करने के लिए प्रेरित किया - स्थिति को खराब करने की कोशिश करने के लिए।
शहर के केंद्र में एक ही साइट पर गुरुवार रात को इसी तरह के टकराव हुए।
पिछले नौ दिनों से सैकड़ों हजारों लोग प्रदर्शन कर रहे हैं।
हेज़बुल्ला नेता हसन नसरल्लाह ने कहा कि सरकार के पतन से गृह युद्ध हो सकता है।
 
बेरुत से अल जज़ीरा की स्टेफनी डेकर की रिपोर्ट।

snippet.title: Has South Africa’s ruling party betrayed Mandela’s legacy? | Head to Head
snippet.description:
In this episode of Head to Head, Mehdi Hasan challenges African National Congress (ANC) stalwart Baleka Mbete on whether, in the 25 years since apartheid, her party has betrayed Nelson Mandela's legacy and the dreams of South Africa's rainbow nation.

Over the past quarter century, access to education has significantly improved and the rights of all South Africans to free basic healthcare has been guaranteed.

But the ANC's successes have been overshadowed by rising youth unemployment, recent xenophobic attacks on African immigrants and ongoing allegations of systemic corruption, with former President Jacob Zuma currently facing trial.

From fighting apartheid, Mbete rose to become one of South Africa's most powerful women, serving as deputy president, speaker of the National Assembly, and chair of the ANC.

We ask whether the ANC, and Mbete personally, have done enough to hold Zuma to account, and keep Mandela's dream of a united Africa alive.

Hasan and Mbete are joined by a panel of three experts:

- Makhosi Khoza - former South African politician who resigned from the ANC in 2017, after calling for President Zuma to step down
- Xolani Xala - founder of South African Business Abroad and member of the ANC
- Andrew Feinstein - former South African politician and author of 'After the Party: A Personal Journey Inside the ANC'. He is now director of Corruption Watch UK

Has South Africa's ruling party betrayed Mandela's legacy? With Baleka Mbete, first broadcast on October 18, 2019, at 20:00 GMT with repeats on October 19 at 12:00GMT, October 20 at 01:00 GMT, and October 21 at 06:00 GMT.

-

sw.title: Je! Chama tawala cha Afrika Kusini kimesaliti urithi wa Mandela?
sw.description:
Katika tukio hili la Mkuu hadi Mkuu, Mehdi Hasan anashinikiza chama kikuu cha African National Congress (ANC), Baleka Mbete, ikiwa katika miaka 25 tangu ubaguzi, chama chake kimesaliti urithi wa Nelson Mandela na ndoto za taifa la mvua la Afrika Kusini.

Katika kipindi cha robo ya karne iliyopita, upatikanaji wa elimu umeboresha sana na haki za Waafrika Kusini kupata huduma ya msingi ya afya imehakikishwa.

Lakini mafanikio ya ANC yamefunikwa na kuongezeka kwa ukosefu wa ajira kwa vijana, mashambulio ya xenophobic ya hivi karibuni kwa wahamiaji wa Kiafrika na tuhuma zinazoendelea za ufisadi wa kimfumo, huku Rais wa zamani Jacob Zuma akikabiliwa na kesi sasa.

Kutoka kwa kupigania ubaguzi wa rangi, Mbete aliibuka kuwa mmoja wa wanawake wenye nguvu Afrika Kusini, akihudumu kama naibu wa rais, spika wa Bunge la Kitaifa, na mwenyekiti wa ANC.

Tunauliza ikiwa ANC, na Mbete kibinafsi, wamefanya vya kutosha kushikilia Zuma, na kutimiza ndoto ya Mandela ya umoja wa Afrika hai.

Hasan na Mbete wamejiunga na jopo la wataalam watatu:

- Makhosi Khoza - mwanasiasa wa zamani wa Afrika Kusini aliyejiuzulu kutoka ANC mnamo 2017, baada ya kumtaka Rais Zuma ajiuzulu
- Xolani Xala - mwanzilishi wa Biashara ya nje ya Afrika Kusini na mjumbe wa ANC
- Andrew Feinstein - mwanasiasa wa zamani wa Afrika Kusini na mwandishi wa 'Baada ya Chama: Safari ya Kibinafsi Ndani ya ANC'. Sasa ni mkurugenzi wa Rushwa Watch UK

es.title: ¿El partido gobernante de Sudáfrica ha traicionado el legado de Mandela?
es.description:
En este episodio de Head to Head, Mehdi Hasan desafía a Baleka Mbete, incondicional del Congreso Nacional Africano (ANC), sobre si, en los 25 años transcurridos desde el apartheid, su partido ha traicionado el legado de Nelson Mandela y los sueños de la nación del arco iris de Sudáfrica.

Durante el último cuarto de siglo, el acceso a la educación ha mejorado significativamente y se ha garantizado el derecho de todos los sudafricanos a recibir atención médica básica gratuita.

Pero los éxitos del ANC se han visto eclipsados ​​por el aumento del desempleo juvenil, los recientes ataques xenófobos contra inmigrantes africanos y las continuas denuncias de corrupción sistémica, con el ex presidente Jacob Zuma actualmente en juicio.

De luchar contra el apartheid, Mbete se levantó para convertirse en una de las mujeres más poderosas de Sudáfrica, sirviendo como vicepresidenta, presidenta de la Asamblea Nacional y presidenta del ANC.

Preguntamos si el ANC, y Mbete personalmente, han hecho lo suficiente para hacer que Zuma rinda cuentas y mantener vivo el sueño de Mandela de una África unida.

Hasan y Mbete se unen por un panel de tres expertos:

- Makhosi Khoza - ex político sudafricano que renunció al ANC en 2017, luego de pedir al presidente Zuma que renunciara
- Xolani Xala - fundador de South African Business Abroad y miembro de ANC
- Andrew Feinstein - ex político sudafricano y autor de 'After the Party: A Personal Journey Inside the ANC'. Ahora es director de Corruption Watch UK.

zu.title: Ingabe iqembu elibusayo laseNingizimu Afrika liyikhashile ifa likaMandela?
zu.description:
Kulesi sihloko seNhloko kuya eNhloko, uMehdi Hasan uphonsela uBaleka Mbete amandla, ukuthi, eminyakeni engama-25 selokhu ubandlululo, iqembu lakhe selithengise ifa likaNelson Mandela namaphupho esizwe saseNingizimu Afrika esibamba imvula.

Kulesi sikhulu sekwedlule leminyaka, ukufinyelela emfundweni sekuthuthuke kakhulu futhi namalungelo abo bonke abantu baseNingizimu Afrika ukuthola ukunakekelwa kwezempilo okuyisisekelo kuqinisekisiwe.

Kepha impumelelo ye-ANC ibisibekelwe wukunyuka kwemisebenzi yentsha, ukuhlaselwa kwabokufika okusajwayelekile kwabokufika base-Afrika kanye nezinsolo eziqhubekayo zenkohlakalo ehlelekile, njengoba uMongameli uJacob Zuma njengamanje abhekene necala.

Ukusuka ekulweni nobandlululo, uMbete wasukuma waba ngomunye wabesifazane abanamandla amakhulu waseNingizimu Afrika, esebenza njengephini likamongameli, uSomlomo woMkhandlu Kazwelonke, kanye nosihlalo we-ANC.

Sibuze ukuthi ngabe i-ANC, kanye noMbete uqobo, bakwenzile ngokwanele yini ukuthi uZuma alandise, futhi agcine iphupho likaMandela le-Afrika ebumbene ephila.

UHasan noMbete bajoyinwa yithimba lochwepheshe abathathu:

- UMakhosi Khoza - owayengusopolitiki waseNingizimu Afrika wesula kwi-ANC ngonyaka ka-2017, ngemuva kokubiza uMengameli uZuma ukuba ashiye phansi izintambo
- UXolani Xala - umsunguli weSouth African Business Abroad futhi oyilungu le-ANC
- U-Andrew Feinstein - owayengusopolitiki waseNingizimu Afrika futhi owayengumbhali we-'After Party: A Personal Journey Inside the ANC '. Manje ungumqondisi weCorruption Watch UK

ar.title: هل خذل الحزب الحاكم في جنوب إفريقيا إرث مانديلا؟
ar.description:
في هذه الحلقة من Head to Head ، تتحدى مهدي حسن صديقته في المؤتمر الوطني الإفريقي باليكا مبيتي بشأن ما إذا كان حزبها قد خيانة تراث نيلسون مانديلا وأحلام أمة قوس قزح في جنوب إفريقيا.

على مدار ربع القرن الماضي ، تحسن الوصول إلى التعليم بشكل كبير وتم ضمان حقوق جميع سكان جنوب إفريقيا في الرعاية الصحية الأساسية المجانية.

لكن النجاحات التي حققها حزب المؤتمر الوطني الأفريقي طغت عليها بطالة الشباب المتزايدة والهجمات الأخيرة على كراهية الأجانب للمهاجرين الأفارقة والادعاءات المستمرة بالفساد النظامي ، مع محاكمة الرئيس السابق جاكوب زوما حاليًا.

من القتال ضد الفصل العنصري ، نهضت مبيتي لتصبح واحدة من أقوى النساء في جنوب إفريقيا ، حيث تشغل منصب نائب الرئيس ورئيسة الجمعية الوطنية ورئيسة حزب المؤتمر الوطني الأفريقي.

نحن نسأل ما إذا كان حزب المؤتمر الوطني الأفريقي ومبيتي شخصيا قد فعلوا ما يكفي لمحاسبة زوما ، والحفاظ على حلم مانديلا بإفريقيا موحدة.

انضم حسن ومبيتي إلى لجنة من ثلاثة خبراء:

- ماخوسي خوزا - سياسي جنوب أفريقي سابق استقال من حزب المؤتمر الوطني الأفريقي في عام 2017 ، بعد دعوة الرئيس زوما للتنحي
- Xolani Xala - مؤسس شركة جنوب إفريقيا للأعمال في الخارج وعضو في حزب المؤتمر الوطني الأفريقي
- أندرو فاينشتاين - سياسي جنوب أفريقي سابق ومؤلف كتاب "بعد الحفلة: رحلة شخصية داخل حزب المؤتمر الوطني الأفريقي". وهو الآن مدير قسم مراقبة الفساد في المملكة المتحدة

am.title: የደቡብ አፍሪካ ገዥ አካል የማንዴላን ውርስን አሳልrayedል?
am.description:
መህዲ ሁሴን በዚህ የአርዕስት ክፍል ውስጥ የአፍሪካ ብሔራዊ ኮንግረስ (ኤኤንሲ) አፓርታይድ ከተጀመረበት በ 25 ዓመታት ውስጥ ፓርቲዋ የኔልሰን ማንዴላንን ቅርስ እና የደቡብ አፍሪካ ቀስተ ደመና ህዝብ ህልውናን እንደካተት ይከራከራሉ ፡፡

ያለፈው ሩብ ምዕተ ዓመት የትምህርት ተደራሽነት በከፍተኛ ሁኔታ ተሻሽሏል እናም ሁሉም የደቡብ አፍሪካውያን መሠረታዊ የጤና እንክብካቤ የማግኘት መብታቸው ተረጋግ hasል ፡፡

ግን የኤኤንሲሲ ስኬቶች እየጨመረ በወጣቶች ሥራ አጥነት ፣ በቅርብ ጊዜ በአፍሪካ ስደተኞች ላይ በተፈፀመ አሰቃቂ ጥቃት እና በቀጣይነት ስልታዊ ሙስና በተከሰሱበት ጊዜ የቀድሞው ፕሬዚዳንት ጃኮብ ዙማ በአሁኑ ወቅት ለፍርድ ቀርበዋል ፡፡

አፓርታይድ ከመጣበት ጊዜ Mbete የደቡብ አፍሪካ ኃያላን ሴቶች አን women በመሆን ወደ ምክትል ፕሬዝዳንት ፣ የብሔራዊ ምክር ቤት አፈ ጉባ speaker እና የኤኤንሲው ሊቀመንበር ሆነው አገልግለዋል ፡፡

ANC እና Mbete በግለሰቦች ዙማንን ተጠያቂ ለማድረግ በቂ እንዳደረጉት እና የማንዴላ የአንድነት አፍሪካ ህልውና እንዲቀጥሉ እናደርጋለን ብለን እንጠይቃለን ፡፡

ሀሰን እና Mbete በሦስት ባለሙያዎች ቡድን ይቀላቀላሉ-

- ማቻቾ ኩዛ - እ.ኤ.አ. በ 2017 ከኤኤንሲ ከአስረከቡ በኋላ ፕሬዚዳንት ዙማ ከስልጣን እንዲወጡ ጥሪ ከጠየቁ ፡፡
- Xolani Xala - የደቡብ አፍሪካ ንግድ በውጭ አገር መስራች እና የኤኤንሲ አባል
- አንድሩ ፊንቴንይን - የቀድሞው የደቡብ አፍሪካ ፖለቲከኛ እና የፓርቲው ደራሲ: - በኤኤንሲሲ ውስጥ የግል ጉዞ ፡፡ እሱ አሁን የሙስና ሰዓት ዩኬ ነው

fr.title: Le parti au pouvoir en Afrique du Sud a-t-il trahi l'héritage de Mandela?
fr.description:
Dans cet épisode de Face à face, Mehdi Hasan demande à Baleka Mbete, fidèle au Congrès national africain (ANC), si, au cours des 25 années écoulées depuis l'apartheid, son parti a trahi l'héritage de Nelson Mandela et les rêves de la nation arc-en-ciel d'Afrique du Sud.

Au cours des 25 dernières années, l’accès à l’éducation s’est considérablement amélioré et le droit de tous les Sud-Africains de bénéficier de soins de santé de base gratuits a été garanti.

Mais les succès de l'ANC ont été éclipsés par la montée du chômage des jeunes, les récentes attaques xénophobes contre des immigrants africains et les allégations de corruption systémique, l'ancien président Jacob Zuma étant actuellement en procès.

Après la lutte contre l'apartheid, Mbete est devenue l'une des femmes les plus puissantes d'Afrique du Sud. Elle a été vice-présidente, présidente de l'Assemblée nationale et présidente de l'ANC.

Nous demandons si l'ANC et Mbete personnellement ont suffisamment fait pour que Zuma soit tenu pour responsable et pour que le rêve de Mandela d'une Afrique unie soit vivant.

Hasan et Mbete sont rejoints par un panel de trois experts:

- Makhosi Khoza - ancien homme politique sud-africain qui a démissionné de l'ANC en 2017 après avoir appelé le président Zuma à se retirer
- Xolani Xala - Fondateur de South African Business Abroad et membre de l'ANC
- Andrew Feinstein - ancien homme politique sud-africain et auteur de "Après la fête: un voyage personnel à l'ANC". Il est maintenant directeur de Corruption Watch UK

en.title: Has South Africa’s ruling party betrayed Mandela’s legacy? | Head to Head
en.description:
In this episode of Head to Head, Mehdi Hasan challenges African National Congress (ANC) stalwart Baleka Mbete on whether, in the 25 years since apartheid, her party has betrayed Nelson Mandela's legacy and the dreams of South Africa's rainbow nation.

Over the past quarter century, access to education has significantly improved and the rights of all South Africans to free basic healthcare has been guaranteed.

But the ANC's successes have been overshadowed by rising youth unemployment, recent xenophobic attacks on African immigrants and ongoing allegations of systemic corruption, with former President Jacob Zuma currently facing trial.

From fighting apartheid, Mbete rose to become one of South Africa's most powerful women, serving as deputy president, speaker of the National Assembly, and chair of the ANC.

We ask whether the ANC, and Mbete personally, have done enough to hold Zuma to account, and keep Mandela's dream of a united Africa alive.

Hasan and Mbete are joined by a panel of three experts:

- Makhosi Khoza - former South African politician who resigned from the ANC in 2017, after calling for President Zuma to step down
- Xolani Xala - founder of South African Business Abroad and member of the ANC
- Andrew Feinstein - former South African politician and author of 'After the Party: A Personal Journey Inside the ANC'. He is now director of Corruption Watch UK

Has South Africa's ruling party betrayed Mandela's legacy? With Baleka Mbete, first broadcast on October 18, 2019, at 20:00 GMT with repeats on October 19 at 12:00GMT, October 20 at 01:00 GMT, and October 21 at 06:00 GMT.

-

snippet.title: Turkish troops seize the centre of Syrian border town
snippet.description:
Turkish forces and their allies say they have seized control of the centre of Ras al-Ain, a key Syrian border town, after four days of heavy fighting. Kurdish forces are disputing the claim. 
But advances on the ground have meant a setback in relations with some countries especially the United States.
And Iran, which had urged Turkey to pull its troops, is now offering to mediate between Turkey and the Kurds. 
Al Jazeera's Zeina Khodr reports from the Turkey-Syria border.

ru.title: Турецкие войска захватывают центр сирийского пограничного города
ru.description:
Турецкие силы и их союзники заявляют, что после четырех дней тяжелых боев захватили контроль над центром Рас-эль-Айна, ключевого сирийского пограничного города. Курдские силы оспаривают иск.
Но успехи на местах означали неудачу в отношениях с некоторыми странами, особенно с США.
И Иран, который призвал Турцию вывести свои войска, теперь предлагает посредничество между Турцией и курдами.
Зейна Ходр из "Аль-Джазиры" сообщает о турецко-сирийской границе.

ar.title: القوات التركية تسيطر على وسط بلدة الحدود السورية
ar.description:
تقول القوات التركية وحلفاؤها إنها سيطرت على وسط رأس العين ، وهي بلدة رئيسية على الحدود السورية ، بعد أربعة أيام من القتال العنيف. القوات الكردية تشكك في هذا الادعاء.
لكن التقدم على الأرض كان يعني انتكاسة في العلاقات مع بعض الدول وخاصة الولايات المتحدة.
وإيران ، التي حثت تركيا على سحب قواتها ، تعرض الآن الوساطة بين تركيا والأكراد.
زينة خضر من قناة الجزيرة تتحدث عن الحدود التركية السورية.

de.title: Türkische Truppen erobern das Zentrum der syrischen Grenzstadt
de.description:
Die türkischen Streitkräfte und ihre Verbündeten geben an, nach vier Tagen heftiger Kämpfe die Kontrolle über das Zentrum von Ras al-Ain, einer wichtigen syrischen Grenzstadt, übernommen zu haben. Kurdische Streitkräfte bestreiten die Behauptung.
Fortschritte vor Ort bedeuteten jedoch einen Rückschlag in den Beziehungen zu einigen Ländern, insbesondere den Vereinigten Staaten.
Und der Iran, der die Türkei aufgefordert hatte, ihre Truppen abzuziehen, bietet nun an, zwischen der Türkei und den Kurden zu vermitteln.
Al Jazeeras Zeina Khodr berichtet von der türkisch-syrischen Grenze.

fr.title: Les troupes turques s'emparent du centre de la ville frontalière syrienne
fr.description:
Les forces turques et leurs alliés affirment avoir pris le contrôle du centre de Ras al-Ain, une ville clé à la frontière syrienne, après quatre jours de violents combats. Les forces kurdes contestent cette affirmation.
Mais les avancées sur le terrain ont entraîné un recul des relations avec certains pays, en particulier les États-Unis.
Et l'Iran, qui avait exhorté la Turquie à retirer ses troupes, propose maintenant une médiation entre la Turquie et les Kurdes.
Zeina Khodr d'Al Jazeera rapporte de la frontière turco-syrienne.

fa.title: سربازان ترکیه مرکز شهر مرزی سوریه را تصرف می کنند
fa.description:
نیروهای ترکیه و متحدان آنها می گویند که آنها پس از چهار روز درگیری سنگین ، کنترل مرکز راس العین ، یک شهر مهم مرزی سوریه را به دست آورده اند. نیروهای کرد در حال ادعای این ادعا هستند.
اما پیشرفت در این زمینه به معنای عقب نشینی در روابط با برخی کشورها به ویژه ایالات متحده است.
و ایران که از ترکیه خواسته بود تا نیروهای خود را بکشد ، اکنون در حال میانجیگری بین ترکیه و کردها است.
گزارش زینا خودرو از الجزیره از مرز ترکیه و سوریه است.

tr.title: Türk birlikleri Suriye sınır kasabasının merkezini ele geçirdi
tr.description:
Türk kuvvetleri ve müttefikleri, dört gün süren ağır çatışmaların ardından, Suriye sınırındaki önemli bir şehir olan Ras el-Ain merkezinin kontrolünü ele geçirdiklerini söylediler. Kürt kuvvetleri bu iddiaya itiraz ediyor.
Ancak, ülkedeki gelişmeler, başta ABD olmak üzere bazı ülkelerle ilişkilerde bir aksama anlamına geliyordu.
Ve Türkiye'yi askerlerini çekmeye çağıran İran, şimdi Türkiye ile Kürtler arasında arabuluculuk yapmayı teklif ediyor.
El Cezire’nin Zeina Khodr’ı Türkiye-Suriye sınırından rapor ediyor.

snippet.title: No-deal Brexit: Destiny or disaster? | Head to Head
snippet.description:
In this episode of Head to Head, Mehdi Hasan challenges businessman-turned-politician Richard Tice, the chair of the United Kingdom's Brexit Party, on his campaign for a "no deal" or "clean" exit from the European Union.

Editor's note: Since the recording of this show on September 30, 2019, Rachel Warby has been deselected and is no longer the prospective parliamentary candidate for the Brexit Party.

In addition to being elected as a member of the European Parliament (MEP) in May 2019, Tice cofounded the successful pro-Brexit campaign Leave.EU before the June 2016 referendum. He went on to fund the Leave Means Leave campaign immediately after the vote.

Tice dismisses official warnings about the impact of a "no-deal" Brexit on the UK's economy and believes that sovereignty is paramount, adding: "We get back our sovereignty from the European Union, back to Parliament, and back to the people. So that is, you know, that is something that is absolutely priceless, we must achieve that."

Hasan and Tice are joined by a panel of three experts:

- Graham Gudgin - a pro-Brexit economist at Cambridge University and chief economic adviser at the conservative think-tank, Policy Exchange
- Jonathan Lis - the deputy director for the pro-Europe think-tank, British Influence
- Ash Sarkar - a senior editor at the progressive online media outlet, Novara Media

After the recording at the Oxford Union, Tice said: "The ultimate challenge is both to survive and enjoy an hour of intense Head to Head with Mehdi Hasan. It sharpens you up and keeps you on your toes. I loved it!" (October 1, 2019)

No-deal Brexit: Destiny or disaster? with Richard Tice first broadcast on October 11, 2019, at 20:00 GMT and repeat telecasts on October 12 at 12:00GMT, October 13 at 01:00 GMT, and October 14 at 06:00 GMT.

-
