snippet.title: 🇮🇹 🇪🇸 Italy coastguard to accompany Aquarius to Spain | Al Jazeera English
snippet.description:
Italy has been called cynical and irresponsible for refusing to allow a ship carrying 629 refugees to dock. Malta has also refused permission.

Preparations are now being made for the ship to head to Spain, which offered to take them in.

The journey to the Spanish port of Valencia will take three to four days, the boat will be accompanied by two Italian coastguard boats, carrying some of the refugees to ease crowding.

Al Jazeera's Jonah Hull reports from Rome.

it.title: 🇮🇹 🇪🇸 Guardia costiera d'Italia per accompagnare l'Acquario in Spagna | Al Jazeera inglese
it.description:
L'Italia è stata definita cinica e irresponsabile per aver rifiutato di consentire a una nave che trasportava 629 rifugiati di attraccare. Anche Malta ha rifiutato il permesso.

Si stanno ora preparando i preparativi per la partenza della nave in Spagna, che si è offerta di accoglierli.

Il viaggio verso il porto spagnolo di Valencia durerà dai tre ai quattro giorni, la barca sarà accompagnata da due barche della guardia costiera italiane, portando alcuni dei rifugiati per facilitare l'affollamento.

Jonah Hull di Al Jazeera riporta da Roma.

es.title: Guardia costera de Italia para acompañar a Acuario a España
es.description:
Italia ha sido llamada cínica e irresponsable por negarse a permitir que un barco que transportaba a 629 refugiados atracara. Malta también ha rechazado el permiso.

Se están haciendo los preparativos para que el barco se dirija a España, que se ofreció a llevarlos.

El viaje al puerto español de Valencia tomará de tres a cuatro días, el barco estará acompañado por dos barcos de guardacostas italianos, llevando a algunos de los refugiados para facilitar el hacinamiento.

El Jonah Hull de Al Jazeera informa desde Roma.

de.title: 🇪🇸 🇪🇸 Italienische Küstenwache begleitet Wassermann nach Spanien | Al Jazeera Englisch
de.description:
Italien wurde als zynisch und verantwortungslos bezeichnet, weil es sich geweigert hatte, einem Schiff, das 629 Flüchtlinge anlegte, zu docken. Malta hat auch die Erlaubnis verweigert.

Es werden Vorbereitungen getroffen, damit das Schiff nach Spanien fahren kann, wo es angeboten wird, sie aufzunehmen.

Die Reise in den spanischen Hafen von Valencia dauert drei bis vier Tage. Das Boot wird von zwei italienischen Küstenwachbooten begleitet, die einige der Flüchtlinge mitnehmen, um das Gedränge zu erleichtern.

Jonas Hull von Al Jazeera berichtet aus Rom.

hi.title: स्पेन के कुंभ के साथ 🇮🇹 🇪🇸 इटली तटगाड़ी | अल जज़ीरा अंग्रेजी
hi.description:
इटली को 629 शरणार्थियों को डॉक करने के लिए जहाज की अनुमति देने से इनकार करने के लिए सनकी और गैर जिम्मेदार कहा गया है। माल्टा ने अनुमति से इंकार कर दिया है।

अब जहाज के लिए स्पेन जाने के लिए तैयारी की जा रही है, जिसने उन्हें अंदर ले जाने की पेशकश की।

वैलेंसिया के स्पेनिश बंदरगाह की यात्रा में तीन से चार दिन लगेंगे, नाव के साथ दो इतालवी तटगाड़ी नौकाएं भी होंगी, जिसमें कुछ शरणार्थियों को भीड़ को कम करने के लिए ले जाया जाएगा।

अल जज़ीरा की जोना हुल रोम से रिपोर्ट करता है।

ar.description:
وقد سميت إيطاليا بالسخرية وعدم المسؤولية لرفضها السماح لسفينة تحمل 629 لاجئًا بالهبوط. كما رفضت مالطا الإذن بذلك.

ويجري الآن الاستعدادات للسفينة للتوجه إلى إسبانيا ، التي عرضت نقلها.

وتستغرق الرحلة إلى ميناء فالنسيا الأسباني ثلاثة إلى أربعة أيام ، وسيرافق القارب اثنان من زوارق حرس الشواطئ الإيطالية ، تحمل بعض اللاجئين لتخفيف الازدحام.

snippet.title: 🇨🇴 Colombia elections: Voters head to polls to elect new president | Al Jazeera English
snippet.description:
Colombians will be heading to the polls to elect a new president on Sunday.

They will be choosing between two main candidates with opposing views on the future of the peace accord between the government and the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia, or FARC, rebels.

The emergence of new rebel groups is putting that deal under scrutiny.

Al Jazeera's Lucia Newman reports from Bogota.

snippet.title: 🇺🇸 This is Antifa: Behind the mask of the US anti-fascist movement | Fault Lines
snippet.description:
Ever since the video of a black-clad anarchist punching white supremacist leader Richard Spencer went viral on the day of Donald Trump's inauguration, the loosely-knit anti-fascist movement known as Antifa has gained new popularity and scrutiny in the United States.

Antifa is a fringe movement, a loose collection of organisations and ideas with no party line and no formal leadership, but their fight against the far right has found centre stage in the polarised climate of Trump's America.
"When the fascists stick their head out of the ground, and say, 'we're going to be here on this day, to march in support of our white greatness', that's gross. And that's when people organise, get together, and bash the fash," says a medic who tends to the wounded at street protests.

The first year of Trump's presidency saw an increase in hate crimes and racist violence, and Antifa has often responded to that threat with violence of their own.

The rise of violent conflict across the country "is not surprising when we have a president who openly talks about beating people up and is fanning the flames of hatred and division," says Jesse Arreguin, the mayor of Berkeley, California. His city has seen a number of clashes between Antifa and right wing activists.

Fault Lines travelled to Berkeley, Portland, and Seattle, to get a rare glimpse behind the mask of Antifa - whose activists are determined to fight the rise of white supremacist groups in the US by any means.

And while Antifa's unique brand of resistance has lent the movement new fame, their high-profile acts of political violence and controversial street tactics to counter hate crimes present strategic dilemmas for the left.

"Punching people in the face or advocating censorship or the abolition of free speech is a very dangerous road to begin to walk down," says Chris Hedges, who has written multiple essays criticising Antifa and believes that the real fight is not with fringe groups but with corporate and government forces. "It's always the left that pays."

"We have very dark, sinister, totalitarian forces that are snuffing out the last vestiges of American democracy. And we better revolt, we better respond. Carrying out these kinds of street confrontations, plays right into the hands of these centres of power," says Hedges.

And while Antifa's unique brand of resistance has lent the movement new fame, their high-profile acts of political violence and controversial street tactics to counter hate crimes present strategic dilemmas for the left.

"Punching people in the face or advocating censorship or the abolition of free speech is a very dangerous road to begin to walk down," says Chris Hedges, who has written multiple essays criticising Antifa and believes that the real fight is not with fringe groups but with corporate and government forces. "It's always the left that pays."

"We have very dark, sinister, totalitarian forces that are snuffing out the last vestiges of American democracy. And we better revolt, we better respond. Carrying out these kinds of street confrontations, plays right into the hands of these centres of power," says Hedges.

en.title: 🇺🇸 This is Antifa: Behind the mask of the US anti-fascist movement | Fault Lines
en.description:
Ever since the video of a black-clad anarchist punching white supremacist leader Richard Spencer went viral on the day of Donald Trump's inauguration, the loosely-knit anti-fascist movement known as Antifa has gained new popularity and scrutiny in the United States.

Antifa is a fringe movement, a loose collection of organisations and ideas with no party line and no formal leadership, but their fight against the far right has found centre stage in the polarised climate of Trump's America.
"When the fascists stick their head out of the ground, and say, 'we're going to be here on this day, to march in support of our white greatness', that's gross. And that's when people organise, get together, and bash the fash," says a medic who tends to the wounded at street protests.

The first year of Trump's presidency saw an increase in hate crimes and racist violence, and Antifa has often responded to that threat with violence of their own.

The rise of violent conflict across the country "is not surprising when we have a president who openly talks about beating people up and is fanning the flames of hatred and division," says Jesse Arreguin, the mayor of Berkeley, California. His city has seen a number of clashes between Antifa and right wing activists.

Fault Lines travelled to Berkeley, Portland, and Seattle, to get a rare glimpse behind the mask of Antifa - whose activists are determined to fight the rise of white supremacist groups in the US by any means.

And while Antifa's unique brand of resistance has lent the movement new fame, their high-profile acts of political violence and controversial street tactics to counter hate crimes present strategic dilemmas for the left.

"Punching people in the face or advocating censorship or the abolition of free speech is a very dangerous road to begin to walk down," says Chris Hedges, who has written multiple essays criticising Antifa and believes that the real fight is not with fringe groups but with corporate and government forces. "It's always the left that pays."

"We have very dark, sinister, totalitarian forces that are snuffing out the last vestiges of American democracy. And we better revolt, we better respond. Carrying out these kinds of street confrontations, plays right into the hands of these centres of power," says Hedges.

hi.title: 🇺🇸 यह एंटीफा है: अमेरिका के विरोधी फासीवादी आंदोलन के मुखौटे के पीछे फाल्ट लाइन्स
hi.description:
जब से ब्लैक-कपड अराजकतावादी सफ़ेद सुपरमैसिस्ट नेता रिचर्ड स्पेन्सर का वीडियो डोनाल्ड ट्रम्प के उद्घाटन के दिन वायरल हो गया, तब से एंटीफा के रूप में जाना जाने वाला ढीला-बुनना विरोधी फासीवादी आंदोलन ने संयुक्त राज्य अमेरिका में नई लोकप्रियता और जांच की है। 

 एंटीफा एक फ्रिंज आंदोलन है, संगठनों और विचारों का ढीला ढांचा, कोई पार्टी लाइन नहीं है और कोई औपचारिक नेतृत्व नहीं है, लेकिन दूर के खिलाफ उनकी लड़ाई ने ट्रम्प के अमेरिका के ध्रुवीकृत जलवायु में केंद्र स्तर पाया है। 
 "जब फासीवादी अपने सिर को जमीन से बाहर निकलते हैं, और कहते हैं, 'हम इस दिन यहां जा रहे हैं, हमारी सफेद महानता के समर्थन में मार्च के लिए', जो कि सकल है। और जब लोग व्यवस्थित हो जाते हैं, इकट्ठा होते हैं, और सड़क के विरोध में घायल हो जाने वाली एक डॉक्टर कहते हैं, 

 ट्रम्प के राष्ट्रपति पद के पहले वर्ष में नफरत अपराधों और नस्लवादी हिंसा में वृद्धि देखी गई और एंटीफा ने अक्सर अपने स्वयं के हिंसा से इस खतरे को जवाब दिया। 

 कैलिफ़ोर्निया के बर्कले के मेयर जेसी अर्रेगुइन कहते हैं, "देश भर में हिंसक संघर्ष का उदय" आश्चर्यजनक नहीं है, जब हमारे पास एक राष्ट्रपति है जो खुलेआम लोगों को मारने के बारे में बात करता है और नफरत और विभाजन की लपटें फैंसी कर रहा है। " उनके शहर में Antifa और right wing कार्यकर्ताओं के बीच कई संघर्ष हुए हैं। 

 एंटीफा के मुखौटा के पीछे एक दुर्लभ झलक पाने के लिए फॉल्ट लाइंस बर्कले, पोर्टलैंड और सिएटल गए, जिनके कार्यकर्ता अमेरिका में किसी भी तरह से सफेद अतिमहत्ववादी समूहों के उदय से लड़ने के लिए निर्धारित हैं। 

 और जब एंटीफा के अनूठे ब्रांड के प्रतिरोध ने आंदोलन में नई ख्याति दी है, उनके उच्च राजनीतिक हिंसा और विवादास्पद सड़क की रणनीतिएं नफरत अपराधों का विरोध करने के लिए बाएं के लिए सामरिक दुविधाएं पेश करती हैं। 

 क्रिस हेजस कहते हैं, "चेहरे में लोगों को छेड़ने या सेंसरशिप की वकालत करने या मुक्त भाषण उन्मूलन करना एक बहुत ही खतरनाक रास्ता है, जो नीचे चलना शुरू कर देता है," एंटीफा की आलोचना करते हुए कई निबंधों को लिखा है और यह मानता है कि असली लड़ाई फ्रिंज समूहों के साथ नहीं है बल्कि कॉर्पोरेट और सरकारी बलों के साथ "यह हमेशा शेष है जो भुगतान करता है।" 

 "हमारे पास बहुत अंधेरा, भयावह, अधिनायकवादी ताक़ा है जो अमेरिकी लोकतंत्र के अंतिम अवशेषों को खत्म कर रहे हैं। और हम बेहतर विद्रोह करते हैं, हम बेहतर जवाब देते हैं। इन प्रकार के सड़क के टकराव को उठाकर, इन केंद्रों के अधिकारों के हाथों में खेलता है," हेजेज कहते हैं

ar.title: 🇺🇸 هذه أنتيفا: وراء قناع الحركة الأمريكية المناهضة للفاشية خطوط الصدع
ar.description:
فمنذ تصوير فيديو أناركي متشدد يهاجم الزعيم العنصري الأبيض ريتشارد سبنسر في يوم تنصيب دونالد ترامب ، اكتسبت الحركة المناهضة للفاشية والمتماسكة والمعروفة باسم أنتيفا شعبية وتدقيقاً جديدين في الولايات المتحدة. 

 إن أنتيفا هي حركة هامشية ، ومجموعة فضفاضة من المنظمات والأفكار دون أي خط حزبي ولا قيادة رسمية ، لكن معركتها ضد اليمين المتطرف وجدت مركز الصدارة في المناخ المستقطب لأمريكا ترامب. 
 "عندما يلح الفاشيين رأسهم من الأرض ، ويقولون:" سنكون هنا في هذا اليوم ، لنسعى لدعم عظمتنا البيضاء "، هذا فظيع. وهذا عندما ينظم الناس ، يجتمعون ، يقول الطبيب الذي يميل إلى الجرحى في مظاهرات الشوارع: "سحقوا الوعاء". 

 شهدت السنة الأولى من رئاسة ترامب زيادة في جرائم الكراهية والعنف العنصري ، وكثيراً ما استجابت أنتيفا لهذا التهديد بعنف خاص بها. 

 يقول جيسي أريغوين ، عمدة بيركلي ، كاليفورنيا: إن صعود الصراع العنيف في جميع أنحاء البلاد "ليس مفاجئاً عندما يكون لدينا رئيس يتحدث علناً عن ضرب الناس ويعزز نار الكراهية والانقسام". شهدت مدينته عددا من المصادمات بين أنتيفا والناشطين اليمينيين. 

 سافرت خطوط الصدع إلى بيركلي ، بورتلاند ، وسيتل ، للحصول على لمحة نادرة وراء قناع أنتيفا - الذي كان نشطاءه عازمين على مقاومة صعود مجموعات التفوق البيض في الولايات المتحدة بأي وسيلة. 

 وعلى الرغم من أن العلامة الفريدة للمقاومة التي تتمتع بها أنتفة قد أفضت إلى شهرة الشهرة الجديدة ، فإن أعمال العنف السياسي التي تنتهجها رفيعة المستوى وتكتيكات الشوارع المثيرة للجدل لمواجهة جرائم الكراهية تمثل معضلات استراتيجية لليسار. 

 يقول كريس هيدجز ، الذي كتب العديد من المقالات التي تنتقد أنتيفا ويعتقد أن المعركة الحقيقية ليست مع مجموعات هامشية ، لكن "إن توجيه الناس إلى الوجوه أو الدعوة إلى فرض الرقابة أو إلغاء حرية التعبير هو طريق خطير للغاية للبدء في السير". مع الشركات والقوات الحكومية. "إنه دائما اليسار الذي يدفع." 

 "لدينا قوى شريرة مظلمة وشريرة للغاية تقضي على آخر بقايا الديمقراطية الأمريكية. ونحن نثور بشكل أفضل ، نستجيب بشكل أفضل. القيام بهذه الأنواع من المواجهات في الشوارع ، اللعب في أيدي مراكز السلطة هذه". يقول التحوط.

snippet.title: 🇺🇸 🇮🇶 Is it time the US apologised for invading Iraq? | Upfront
snippet.description:
Fifteen years after the US-led invasion of Iraq, the consequences of the subsequent war continue to be debated. According to the UN Refugee Agency more than four million people have been displaced. There is no widely accepted figure for civilian deaths, but estimates run from the hundreds of thousands into millions. 

"Would we like a do-over, of course we would," says Mark Kimmitt, retired US Brigadier General who served as deputy director of operations and chief military spokesman in Iraq from 2003 to 2004.

While Kimmitt accepts the US "did get some things wrong" in Iraq, he says his country's military has nothing to apologise for.

Actions taken by the US at the beginning of the war continue to have reverberating consequences, including allegations that US detention centres such as Camp Bucca became breeding grounds for armed groups in Iraq and helped to lay the groundwork for the formation of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (also known as ISILor ISIS).

"I was worried at the time that the mass incarceration of what the troops on the ground believed to be security threats would come back to haunt us," says Kimmitt. "I told that to my colleagues and I told that to my superiors." While he agrees the Iraq War may have inspired violent groups, Kimmitt insists ISIL was not created in Iraq.

Kimmitt served in Iraq at a time of alleged massacres committed by US soldiers. When asked about dozens of unarmed civilians being killed in places like Fallujah, Haditha, Mahmoudiya and Balad, Kimmitt refutes any claim that civilians were intentionally killed by American soldiers.

"I am not suggesting for a moment that war doesn't sometimes kill innocent civilians. That's the price of war," he says. "As a soldier what you do is try to minimise it at all costs. But anybody that believes that collateral damage doesn't happen in war is living in a fool's paradise."

In this week's UpFront special, we challenge former US Brigadier General Mark Kimmitt on the consequences and lessons learnt after 15 years of war in Iraq.

snippet.title: 🇸🇱 Sierra Leone: Voters head to polls to elect new president
snippet.description:
Voters in Sierra Leone head to the polls later on Wednesday to choose a new president. 

The leaders of 16 political parties are vying to succeed current leader Ernest Bai Koroma.

But many voters doubt the candidates are up to the job of reviving the country's ailing economy.

Al Jazeera's Ahmed Idris reports from the capital, Freetown.

zh.title: 塞拉利昂：选民前往投票选举新总统
zh.description:
塞拉利昂选民将于周三晚些时候参加民意调查，选出一位新总统。

16个政党领导人正在争取接替现任领导人白内罗马。

但许多选民怀疑候选人是否能够恢复该国经济不景气的工作。

半岛电视台的艾哈迈德伊德里斯从首都弗里敦报道。

ar.title: سيراليون: الناخبون يتوجهون إلى صناديق الاقتراع لانتخاب رئيس جديد
ar.description:
ويتوجه الناخبون في سيراليون إلى صناديق الاقتراع في وقت لاحق يوم الأربعاء لاختيار رئيس جديد.

يتنافس زعماء 16 حزبا سياسيا على نجاح الزعيم الحالي ارنست باي كوروما.

ولكن العديد من الناخبين يشككون فى ان المرشحين يصلون الى وظيفة احياء الاقتصاد الضعيف للبلاد.

الجزيرة أحمد إدريس تقارير من العاصمة ، فريتاون.

sw.title: Sierra Leone: Wapiga kura wanapiga kura kupiga kura rais mpya
sw.description:
Wapiga kura nchini Sierra Leone wanakuja uchaguzi baada ya Jumatano kumchagua rais mpya.

Viongozi wa vyama vya siasa 16 wanajitahidi kupindua kiongozi wa sasa Ernest Bai Koroma.

Lakini wapiga kura wengi huwa na shaka kuwa wagombea wanafanya kazi ya kufufua uchumi wa nchi mbaya.

hi.title: सिएरा लियोन: नए राष्ट्रपति का चुनाव करने के लिए मतदाता प्रमुख हैं
hi.description:
सिएरा लियोन के प्रमुखों में बुधवार को एक नए राष्ट्रपति का चुनाव करने के लिए मतदान के बाद मतदान हुआ।

16 राजनीतिक दलों के नेता मौजूदा नेता अर्नेस्ट बाई कोरोमा को सफल बनाने के लिए उत्सुक हैं।

लेकिन कई मतदाताओं का संदेह है कि उम्मीदवार देश की बीमार अर्थव्यवस्था को पुनर्जीवित करने के काम पर निर्भर हैं।

अल जज़ीरा के अहमद इडिस की राजधानी, फ़्रीटाउन से रिपोर्ट

snippet.title: Iran protests: Head of army declares end of unrest 🇮🇷
snippet.description:
Iran's army chief declared on Thursday that police had already quelled anti-government unrest that has killed 21 people, but said his troops were ready to intervene if needed.
 
Rallies in support of the government have been held across Iran for a second day.
 
Al Jazeera's Zein Basravi reports from Tehran.

snippet.title: 'Jerusalem 🇵🇸 is the make it or break it' - UpFront
snippet.description:
This week US President Donald Trump formally recognised Jerusalem as the capital of Israel, breaking with decades of US policy and disregarding warnings from the international community.

Palestinian Authority President Mahmoud Abbas rejected the announcement and said the US could no longer be a mediator in peace talks.

So, what effect does this have on the two-state solution?  And what does this mean for the US as a mediator between the two parties? 

"They [the Trump administration] aimed a shot at the heart of the two-state solution, which is Jerusalem," says Husam Zomlot, the head of the Palestine Liberation Organisation's General Delegation to the US. "The two-state solution, from the US point of view and mediation, is dead." 

In this week's Headliner, the leader of the Palestinian US delegation, Husam Zomlot, discusses the ramifications of Trump's Jerusalem announcement.

snippet.title: Trump names Jerome Powell to head Federal Reserve
snippet.description:
US President Donald Trump has named Jerome Powell to lead the Federal Reserve.  
Powell is a multi-millionaire who currently serves on the bank's board.
He was one of five candidates interviewed for the role, including current chair Janet Yellen whose term finishes in February.
Al Jazeera’s Alan Fisher reports from Washington, DC.

snippet.title: What makes someone a 'feminist'? - UpFront
snippet.description:
As a new generation of feminists have risen up around the world in what's been called "Third Wave" or “Choice” feminism, many are questioning: should feminists support all women's choices or are some choices actually holding women back? 

“People can make personal choices as much as they want, but how does that contribute to the liberation of all women?” asks Meghan Murphy. 

“I believe in a variety of approaches to feminism, says Jamia Wilson, adding that she believes that liberation will come when society dismantles patriarchy, capitalism, white supremacy, and imperialism, but that she also knows that “different people have different experiences and theories of change about how to get to liberation.”

So, what makes a feminist? In this week’s Arena, we debate this with Meghan Murphy, Founder of Feminist Current, and Jamia Wilson, Executive Director at Feminist Press.

More from UpFront on:

YouTube - http://aje.io/upfrontYT
Facebook - http://facebook.com/ajUpFront
Twitter - http://twitter.com/ajUpFront
Website - http://aljazeera.com/upfront

snippet.title: Muslim Aid head talks about dire situation in Myanmar’s Rakhine
snippet.description:
Al Jazeera speaks to Jehangir Malik, CEO of Muslim Aid, a UK-based organisation, about the situation in Myanmar’s Rakhine state. 
Malik has just returned from Sittwe in Rakhine and has seen the devastation wrought upon the Rohingya, where aid has been scaled down due to the security situation. 
Meanwhile, the northern part of Rakhine state is completely isolated with no aid making it through.

snippet.title: Germany's Angela Merkel leads polls after televised debate
snippet.description:
German Chancellor Angela Merkel has vowed to work with the EU to stop Turkey's bid to join the bloc, if she is re-elected later this month.
Merkel made the comments in a televised debate with her main rival, Martin Schulz, who said he would block Turkey's EU accession talks if he wins.

The pair also debated migration and security in the only televised debate of the election.

Schulz had been gaining in polls, but figures released after the debate suggested Merkel put in the best performance.

Al Jazeera's Dominic Kane reports from Berlin.

hi.title: जर्मनी की एंजेला मार्केल टेलिविज़न बहस के बाद चुनावों का नेतृत्व करती है
hi.description:
जर्मन चांसलर एंजेला मार्केल ने यूरोपीय संघ के साथ मिलकर काम करने की इजाजत दी है ताकि वह इस महीने में फिर से निर्वाचित हो सकें। 
 मार्केल ने अपने मुख्य प्रतिद्वंद्वी मार्टिन स्कूल्ज़ के साथ एक टेलीविजन विवाद में टिप्पणी की, जिन्होंने कहा था कि यदि वह जीतता है तो वह तुर्की के यूरोपीय संघ के प्रवेश वार्ता को रोक देगा। 

 इस जोड़ी ने चुनाव की एकमात्र टेलिविज़ट बहस में माइग्रेशन और सुरक्षा पर भी बहस की। 

 Schulz चुनाव में प्राप्त कर रहा था, लेकिन बहस के बाद जारी आंकड़े मार्केल का सुझाव दिया कि सर्वश्रेष्ठ प्रदर्शन में डाल दिया। 

 अल जज़ीरा की डोमिनिक केन बर्लिन से रिपोर्ट

ar.title: وتقود انجيلا ميركل الالمانية استطلاعات الرأي بعد نقاش متلفز
ar.description:
وقد تعهدت المستشارة الالمانية انجيلا ميركل بالعمل مع الاتحاد الاوربى لوقف محاولة تركيا الانضمام الى الكتلة اذا تم اعادة انتخابها فى وقت لاحق من هذا الشهر. 
 ادلى ميركل بهذه التصريحات فى نقاش متلفز مع منافسه الرئيسى مارتن شولز الذى قال انه سيعوق محادثات الانضمام للاتحاد الاوروبى اذا ما فاز. 

 وناقش الزوج أيضا الهجرة والأمن في النقاش المتلفز الوحيد للانتخابات. 

 وكان شولز قد كسب في استطلاعات الرأي، ولكن الأرقام التي نشرت بعد المناقشة اقترحت ميركل في أفضل أداء. 

 تقارير دومينيك كين في الجزيرة من برلين.

de.title: Deutschlands Angela Merkel leitet Umfragen nach TV-Debatte
de.description:
Bundeskanzlerin Angela Merkel hat gelobt, mit der EU zusammenzuarbeiten, um das Angebot der Türkei zu beenden, sich dem Block anzuschließen, wenn sie später in diesem Monat wiedergewählt wird. 
 Merkel machte die Kommentare in einer Fernsehdebatte mit ihrem Hauptkonkurrenten Martin Schulz, der sagte, er würde die EU-Beitrittsgespräche der Türkei blockieren, wenn er gewinnt. 

 Das Paar diskutierte auch Migration und Sicherheit in der einzigen TV-Debatte über die Wahl. 

 Schulz hatte in Umfragen gewonnen, aber die Zahlen, die nach der Debatte freigegeben wurden, schlugen vor, dass Merkel die beste Leistung einlegte. 

 Al Jazeeras Dominic Kane berichtet aus Berlin.

snippet.title: Sri Lanka to get first Tamil military leader in 50 years
snippet.description:
Sri Lanka to get first Tamil military leader in 50 years

A member of Sri Lanka's Tamil ethnic minority is set to head a branch of its military for the first time in 50 years. Vice Admiral Travis Sinnaiah is taking charge of Sri Lanka's navy after a highly decorated career. 
 
His appointment is seen as an important step in post-war Sri Lanka, but Tamil parties say the government must do more. 
 
Al Jazeera's Minelle Fernandez reports from Colombo.

snippet.title: 🇦🇫 Is the military strategy in Afghanistan flawed? - UpFront
snippet.description:
This year marks 16 years of unrelenting war in Afghanistan between the US-backed government and the Taliban.

With no end of the war in sight, can the Taliban forces be defeated? Is reconciliation possible?

For Amrullah Saleh, who served in Afghanistan as State Minister for Security Reforms, to defeat the Taliban, US-backed forces must focus on Pakistan instead, calling its southern neighbour the 'root cause' of violence.

'Go to the source, and go to the root cause of this,' says Saleh, who also served for six years as the leader of Afghanistan's spy agency, the National Directorate of Security. 'What the United States does need is [to] come out with more clarity and tell the Pakistanis: We know what you are doing and we are a superpower, but we do not have super-patience.'

In this week's Headliner, Mehdi Hasan challenges former Afghan security official Amrullah Saleh on why he believes the US needs to change its strategy in order to more effectively combat the Taliban.

snippet.title: New law allows Japan’s Emperor Akihito to abdicate
snippet.description:
Japan's parliament has cleared the way for Emperor Akihito to abdicate. 
The 88-year-old Emperor, the ceremonial head of state, signaled his desire to step down last year. 
The move will mark the first imperial abdication in two centuries.
Al Jazeera’s Wayne Hay reports from Tokyo.

snippet.title: UK general election: Britons head to polls on Thursday
snippet.description:
The snap election was called by Prime Minister May, who said she wanted to strengthen her mandate in negotiations with the EU.

Labour focused its campaign on domestic issues such as health and education.

But the campaign quickly switched to a debate about national security, following the attacks in Manchester and London.


Al Jazeera's UK correspondent Barnaby Phillips looks back at the seven-week campaign.

Al Jazeera’s John Holman reports from Mexico.

snippet.title: Ismail Haniya elected new Hamas leader
snippet.description:
Ismail Haniya elected new Hamas leader

Ismail Haniya, Gaza's former prime minister, has been named the new head of Hamas, just days after the Palestinian group softened its stance on Israel, recognising the 1967 borders.

He will succeed longtime leader Khaled Meshaal, who is stepping down after more than 10 years.

Al Jazeera's Whitney Hurst explains.

snippet.description:
Myanmar army chief rules out Rohingya citizenship.

The head of the armed forces in Myanmar has denounced the claim to citizenship by Rohingya Muslims - and defended the government crackdown on them.

Around 100,000 are regarded as undocumented immigrants and confined to camps.

snippet.title: Controversial Hindu politician to lead India's Uttar Pradesh
snippet.description:
Controversial Hindu politician to lead India's Uttar Pradesh

A Hindu priest known for his inflammatory religious rhetoric has been chosen as the head of India's most populous state, where 200 million people live.

The ruling Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has named Yogi Adityanath as the chief minister of Uttar Pradesh.

Adityanath's appointment comes a week after a landslide local election victory for the BJP. Opposition politicians have criticised his appointment, saying he is a religiously divisive figure.

Adityanath's views are at odds with the more moderate public image of Narendra Modi, the Indian prime minister.

Al Jazeera's Rob Matheson explains.

snippet.title: China urges US and North Korea to avoid 'head-on collision'
snippet.description:
China has called on North Korea to suspend its nuclear and missile activities in exchange for the US and South Korea halting military war games, to avoid what it called a "head-on collision".

Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi said that the US and South Korea should end their regular joint military drills in return.
 
He also said South Korea is making a mistake by deploying a US anti-missile defence system, which he said undermined China's security.

Al Jazeera’s Adrian Brown reports from Beijing.

snippet.description:

And in a special interview, we speak to the "mother of South Sudan" and former adviser to President Salva Kiir, Rebecca Garang.

snippet.title: 🇮🇱 Israeli minister: The Bible says West Bank is ours - UpFront
snippet.description:
Last week, in a joint press conference with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, US President Donald Trump surprised the world by appearing to dismiss a long-standing US commitment to a two-state solution to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.

Prominent hard-right Israeli Education Minister, Naftali Bennett, welcomed the statement saying: "The era of a Palestinian state is over."

"There already exists two states for the Palestinians: one in Gaza, a full blown state run by Hamas, and the other is Jordan, where 70 percent of the citizens are, indeed, Palestinians," Bennett told UpFront. "So the discussion is whether we need a third Palestinian state smack in the heart of Israel, and the answer is no."

When asked about the Israeli Supreme Court's 2005 ruling describing the West Bank as under "belligerent occupation", Bennett called it a "political decision" and cited the Bible as proof of Israel's right to the West Bank.

"If you want to say that our land does not belong to us, I suggest you go change the Bible first," says Bennett.

In this week's Headliner, we challenge the Israeli education minister and prominent right-wing leader Naftali Bennett.

hi.title: इजराइली मंत्री: बाइबिल का कहना है कि वेस्ट बैंक हमारा है - अप फ्रॉंट
hi.description:
पिछले हफ्ते इजरायल के प्रधान मंत्री बेंजामिन नेतन्याहू के साथ एक संयुक्त संवाददाता सम्मेलन में, अमेरिकी राष्ट्रपति डोनाल्ड ट्रम्प ने इजरायल-फिलिस्तीनी संघर्ष के दो राज्यों के समाधान के लिए एक दीर्घकालिक अमेरिकी प्रतिबद्धता को खारिज करने के लिए विश्व को आश्चर्य दिलाया।

इज़राइली शिक्षा मंत्री प्रमुख, नाफ्ताली बेनेट,
इस बयान का स्वागत करते हुए कहा: "फिलिस्तीनी राज्य का युग खत्म हो चुका है।"

"पहले से ही फिलिस्तीनियों के लिए दो राज्य मौजूद हैं: गाजा में एक, हमास द्वारा संचालित एक पूर्ण उड़ा हुआ राज्य, और दूसरा जॉर्डन है, जहां 70 प्रतिशत नागरिक वास्तव में फ़िलिस्तीनी हैं," बेनेट ने अपफ्रंट को बताया।
"तो चर्चा यह है कि हमें इस्राइल के दिल में एक तीसरी फिलीस्तीनी राज्य की आवश्यकता है, और इसका उत्तर नहीं है।"

जब इज़राइली सुप्रीम कोर्ट के 2005 के सत्तारूढ़ के बारे में पूछा गया कि वेस्ट बैंक को "संघर्षरत व्यवसाय" के तहत वर्णित किया गया है, तो बेनेट ने इसे "राजनीतिक निर्णय" कहा और बाइबिल का हवाला दिया ताकि पश्चिमी तट के लिए इजरायल के अधिकार का प्रमाण हो।
बेनेट कहते हैं, "अगर आप यह कहना चाहते हैं कि हमारी जमीन हमारी नहीं है, तो मेरा सुझाव है कि आप पहले बाइबल को बदल दें।"

इस हफ्ते के हेडलाइनर में, हम इजरायल के शिक्षा मंत्री और प्रमुख दाएं-विंग नेता Naftali बेनेट को चुनौती देते हैं।

ar.title: الوزير الإسرائيلي: يقول الكتاب المقدس إن الضفة الغربية هي بلدنا
ar.description:
وفى الاسبوع الماضى، فاجأ الرئيس الامريكى دونالد ترامب فى مؤتمر صحفى مشترك مع رئيس الوزراء الاسرائيلى بنيامين نتانياهو العالم برفضه التزام الولايات المتحدة منذ فترة طويلة بحل الدولتين للصراع الاسرائيلى الفلسطينى.

وزير التعليم الإسرائيلي البارز، نفتالي بينيت،
رحب بالبيان الذى جاء فيه "ان عهد دولة فلسطينية قد انتهى".

وقال بينيت ل "أوب فرونت": "هناك بالفعل دولتان للفلسطينيين: واحدة في غزة، دولة كاملة تديرها حماس، والأخرى هي الأردن، حيث 70 في المئة من المواطنين هم في الواقع فلسطينيون".
واضاف "لذلك فان النقاش هو ما اذا كنا بحاجة الى صفعة فلسطينية ثالثة في قلب اسرائيل، والجواب لا".

وردا على سؤال حول قرار المحكمة العليا الاسرائيلية لعام 2005 الذى وصف الضفة الغربية بانها "تحت الاحتلال العدائى"، وصفه بينيت بانه "قرار سياسى" واستشهد بالكتاب المقدس كدليل على حق اسرائيل فى الضفة الغربية.
يقول بينيت: "إذا أردت أن تقول إن أرضنا ليست ملكا لنا، أقترح عليك تغيير الكتاب المقدس أولا".

وفي هذا الأسبوع، نتحدى وزير التعليم الإسرائيلي وزعيم اليمين البارز نفتالي بينيت.

snippet.title: Iraqis head to the US after Trump travel ban freeze
snippet.description:
Within hours of the court order that halted President Donald Trump's travel ban on seven Muslim-majority countries, many people with valid visas are taking the risk of flying again. 

Among them is Fuad Shared, who was detained on his way to the US when the immigration order first came into effect and was forced to return to northern Iraq. 

Al Jazeera's Osama Bin Javaid reports from Erbil.

snippet.title: Is Israeli soldier Elor Azaria a hero or a killer? - Inside Story
snippet.description:
It has been a closely watched trial with an unusual verdict.
 
Unlike previous cases where soldiers are acquitted, an Israeli army sergeant has been convicted of the manslaughter of a Palestinian man.
 
Elor Azaria shot Abed al-Fattah al-Sharif in the head in Hebron as he lay on the ground wounded. A second Palestinian was also shot and killed.
 
Police say al-Sharif stabbed an Israeli guard at a checkpoint. 
 
The court case highlights deep divisions among Israelis.
 
Army generals said the 19-year-old army sergeant who opened fire broke the code of war. 
 
Far-right politicians said video of the shooting made him a scapegoat.
 
What does the guilty verdict say about Israeli society and its relationship to Palestinians? 
 
Presenter: Jane Dutton
 
Guests: Akiva Eldar, Senior Columnist, Al Monitor. 
Issa Amro, Palestinian human rights activist and founder of the Camera Project
Robbie Sabel, Professor, Hebrew University of Jerusalem

snippet.title: 🇺🇸 🌎 Should the US be the world's policeman? - UpFront
snippet.description:
In a world that is said to be "on fire" due to multiple wars and political aggression, do we need a global policeman?

The author of The Will to Lead: America's Indispensable Role in the Global Fight for Freedom, Anders Fogh Rasmussen, thinks so - and the only option would be the United States.

"You could start by asking, 'who else?'" says Rasmussen, also the former head of NATO. "The UN is too weak. A declining Russia is too aggressive. A rising China is https://www.youtube.com/edit?o=U&video_id=HE3NBwrbB2Ystill only a regional power."

"Who else can restore law and order in the world? You only have the US."

In a world that is said to be "on fire" due to multiple wars and political aggression, do we need a global policeman?

The author of The Will to Lead: America's Indispensable Role in the Global Fight for Freedom, Anders Fogh Rasmussen, thinks so - and the only option would be the United States.

"You could start by asking, 'who else?'" says Rasmussen, also the former head of NATO. "The UN is too weak. A declining Russia is too aggressive. A rising China is https://www.youtube.com/edit?o=U&video_id=HE3NBwrbB2Ystill only a regional power."

"Who else can restore law and order in the world? You only have the US."

ar.title: هل يجب أن تكون الولايات المتحدة شرطي العالم؟ - صريح
ar.description:
في عالم يقال إنه "يشتعل" بسبب حروب متعددة وعدوان سياسي ، هل نحتاج إلى شرطي عالمي؟

مؤلف كتاب "الرغبة في القيادة": دور أمريكا الذي لا غنى عنه في النضال العالمي من أجل الحرية ، أندرس فوغ راسموسن ، يعتقد ذلك - والخيار الوحيد هو الولايات المتحدة.

يقول راسموسن ، وهو أيضاً الرئيس السابق لمنظمة حلف شمال الأطلنطي: "يمكن أن تبدأ بالسؤال: من غيرك؟" "الأمم المتحدة ضعيفة للغاية. روسيا المتدهورة عدوانية للغاية. الصين الصاعدة هي https://www.youtube.com/edit؟o=U&video_id=HE3NBwrbB2 ولا توجد سوى قوة إقليمية".

"من يستطيع استعادة القانون والنظام في العالم؟ لديك فقط الولايات المتحدة."

hi.title: क्या अमेरिका दुनिया के पुलिस वाले हो? - अपफ्रंट
hi.description:
कई युद्ध और राजनीतिक आक्रामकता के कारण दुनिया में "आग में" कहा जाता है, क्या हमें एक वैश्विक पुलिसकर्मी की जरूरत है?

द विल टू लीड: अमेरिका की अपरिहार्य भूमिका के लिए ग्लोबल फाइट फॉर फ्रीडम, एंडर्स फोग रासमुसेन, के लेखक सोचते हैं - और एकमात्र विकल्प संयुक्त राज्य होगा

"आप पूछ सकते हैं, 'कौन और कौन?', नाटो के पूर्व प्रमुख रेसमुसेन का कहना है, "संयुक्त राष्ट्र बहुत कमजोर है। रूस में गिरावट बहुत आक्रामक है। चीन का बढ़ता हुआ चीन https://www.youtube.com/edit?o=U&video_id=HE3NBwrbB2 सिर्फ एक क्षेत्रीय शक्ति है।"

"कौन दुनिया में कानून और व्यवस्था को पुनर्स्थापित कर सकता है? आपके पास केवल अमेरिका है।"

snippet.title: FIFA council to discuss whether to ban teams from settlements
snippet.description:
Football's world governing body FIFA is meeting to discuss whether to ban Israeli clubs playing games on illegal settlements in the occupied West bank.

The head of the Palestinian Football Association has said if FIFA doesn't take action he'll appeal to the Court of Arbitration for Sport. for a ruling.

FIFA President Gianni Infantino has said it's one of his "priorities" to resolve the dispute.
 
Al Jazeera’s Bernard Smith reports.

snippet.title: 🇰🇪 Kenyan foreign minister on corruption claims - UpFront
snippet.description:
Kenya has been praised by the World Bank and others for being a technology hub and having one of the fastest growing economies in Africa. The country is also criticised, however, in a PriceWaterhouseCoopers report for its level of corruption. 

This report found that Kenya is the third most corrupt country in the world. The government says it takes corruption seriously and President Uhuru Kenyatta has declared corruption a “threat to national security”. 

In this web extra, Mehdi Hasan presses Kenyan Foreign Minister Amina Mohamed on allegations about the country’s corruption. 

“There’s no country today…that can tell us they are free of corruption,” Mohamed says. “It’s acknowledged by the government that we have a problem and we are addressing that problem.”

Mohamed also denies the country’s auditor-general report that found that $2bn from a Eurobond sale is unaccounted for. 

More from UpFront on:

YouTube - http://aje.io/upfrontYT
Facebook - http://facebook.com/ajUpFront
Twitter - http://twitter.com/ajUpFront
Website - http://aljazeera.com/upfront

snippet.description:

snippet.title: 🇰🇪 Kenya's FM on human rights, refugees and al-Shabab - UpFront
snippet.description:
The armed group al-Shabab continues to sow chaos in Somalia and Kenya, as evidenced by the latest attack which left six dead just a kilometre from the Somali border.

Five years since Kenya first crossed the Somali border to root out al-Shabab fighters, attacks have seemingly increased.

In this week's Headliner, Mehdi Hasan asks Kenyan Foreign Minister Amina Mohamed about her country's achievements against the armed group and if the intervention has backfired.

Amina Mohamed also discusses accusations about the treatment of ethnic Somalis and refugees in the country. Kenya, which has taken more than half a million refugees, hosts one of the largest refugee populations in the world.

We also discuss her government's successes and Kenya's experience with the International Criminal Court.

Editor's note: This interview was recorded before the latest al-Shabab attack in Kenya on October 6, 2016.

More from UpFront on:

YouTube - http://aje.io/upfrontYT
Facebook - http://facebook.com/ajUpFront
Twitter - http://twitter.com/ajUpFront
Website - http://aljazeera.com/upfront

snippet.title: Are the banks still too big to fail? - Counting the Cost
snippet.description:
Germany's biggest bank, and Europe's biggest investment bank, appears to be in trouble. So what do Deutsche Bank's problems say about the overall health of the financial system? Eight years on from the global financial crisis, are the banks still too big to fail?

The bank's troubles date back to 2008, when it mis-sold banking products called Mortgage Backed Securities - the very straw that broke the global financial system almost a decade ago. The US Department of Justice is demanding $14bn back in fines from Deutsche Bank to settle civilian lawsuits related to the mis-selling. 

New European Union bail-in rules mean the German tax payer is protected from involvement with bank fines which all but rules out German state aid.

Deutsche Bank has also failed banking "stress tests", which demonstrate how well banks would do in a severe market shock similar to the global financial crisis. 

But some argue that the position Deutsche Bank finds itself in is not quite as simple as it may seem. With what is predicted to be a solid balance sheet in terms of liquidity and deposit-loans ratio, Chris Wheeler, banking analyst at Atlantic Equities, a US brokerage firm based in London, clarifies:

"The problem it [Deutsche Bank] has is two-fold really: It is still trying to rebuild its earnings in markets that aren't very favourable to it in investment banking. The other problem, of course, is its capital - it has something called a 10.8 percent common equity tier one ratio. That's kind of moderate compared to its peers, but obviously it's under pressure if we have this very substantial US fine." 

With a much stronger balance sheet than some of the biggest banks that fell in the crisis, such as Lehman Brothers, and a solid bill of deposits rendering not liquidity but capital as the main issue for Deutsche Bank, does this further solidify fears of another global crisis?

"This has proved the point that 'too big to fail' is still with us. All the fear that gathered last week about Deutsche Bank and its prospects just reminded everybody that despite the fact that the balance sheets are much stronger, regulators will force banks to hold more capital, more liquidity, despite all of that ... if Deutsche Bank were to collapse into the mode of Lehman Brothers and bankruptcy, the ripples will be absolutely enormous," says Chris Wheeler.

Also on this episode of Counting the Cost:

South Korea's new limits: South Korea's tough new anti-graft laws are sending shockwaves to the local business community. It's now a fine line to tread when wining and dining your guests - if they happen to be a journalist, a teacher or a public servant.

Paris Motor Show and the future of driving: We head to the auto show where it seems to be less about the car and more about the technology inside - which could change the entire driving experience. Kamahl Santamaria talks to Luca de Meo, the CEO of Seat Cars, about change in the automotive industry and the future of driving.

Property and divorce in China: In Naniing, China, a new law is limiting the number of properties a married couple can own. But the government's attempt to curb rising property prices in one of China's biggest cities, has had an unforeseen result: a surge in the divroce rate as couples are splitting up to buy more property. 

More from Counting the Cost on:

YouTube - http://aje.io/countingthecostYT
Website - http://aljazeera.com/countingthecost/

snippet.title: US election 2016: Breaking down the VP debate with Factcheck.org
snippet.description:
US vice presidential nominees Tim Kaine and Mike Pence clashed over immigration, security, and the economy, during a debate in Farmville, Virginia.
The nominees also argued about Democratic presidential hopeful Hillary Clinton's use of a private email server when she was Secretary of State. Also on the agenda were controversial comments made by Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump, such as his comments denigrating Mexicans as rapists and criminals.
Al Jazeera's Kristen Saloomey was joined by Lori Robertson, managing editor of Factcheck.org in Virginia.

snippet.title: Venezuelans head to Argentina to escape hardship
snippet.description:

But while many are trying to reach the US, others are heading south to Argentina because of the ease of obtaining residency in the Latin American nation.

Al Jazeera’s Teresa Bo reports from Buenos Aires.

snippet.title: Pakistan refugees: Undocumented Afghans head home
snippet.description:
Over the past three decades, 1,500,000 Afghans have fled their war-torn country and made Pakistan their home.

Another 1 million are believed to be living in the country without any documentation.

Pakistan wants them to return home by the end of the year.

With no other option, many Afghans are heading home with help from the United Nations Refugee Agency.
 
Al Jazeera’s Kamal Hyder reports from Peshawar.

snippet.title: 🇮🇳 Who actually cares about the Kashmiris? - UpFront (Reality Check)
snippet.description:
Protests and tensions are high in Indian-administered Kashmir following the recent crackdown on demonstrators by Indian security forces.

Governments on both sides of the line have expressed interest in finding a solution to the dispute, saying they have Kashmiris' best interests in mind, but some argue that their actions prove otherwise.

In this week's Reality Check, Mehdi Hasan looks at the actions of both India and Pakistan in Kashmir.

hi.title: तालिबान और नवाज शरीफ पर पाकिस्तान के इमरान खान | अग्रिम
hi.description:
इस सप्ताह के अपफ्रंट में, हम पाकिस्तानी राजनेता इमरान खान पर आरोपों के बारे में बोलते हैं कि वह तालिबान पर बहुत नरम है।

रियलिटी चेक में, मेहदी हसन बताते हैं कि हमें राजनीति में लिंग कोटा की आवश्यकता क्यों है। और एक विशेष साक्षात्कार में, हम जेफरी सैक्स, एक प्रमुख अर्थशास्त्री और बर्नी सैंडर्स के सलाहकार से पूछते हैं, अगर वह अमेरिकी राष्ट्रपति चुनाव में हिलेरी क्लिंटन के लिए वोट करने की योजना बनाते हैं।

ps.description:

په حقیقت کې چک، مهدي حسن تشریح کوي چې ولې موږ په سیاست کې د جندر کوډ ته اړتیا لرو. او په یوه ځانګړې مرکه کې موږ جیفري ساچ، یو مخکښ اقتصادپوه او برني سینډر مشاور، که چیرې هغه پالن وکړي چې د امریکا د ولسمشریزو ټولټاکنو کې هیلري کلینټن ته رایه ورکړي.

snippet.title: Mongolia Elections: Voters head to polls amid economic depression
snippet.description:
Mongolians are voting in a general election and the slowing economy is high on the agenda.
The Democratic Party took power in 2012 during double-digit economic growth, but the economy has since stagnated and the opposition Mongolian People's Party could make gains.
 
Al Jazeera’s Scott Heidler reports from the capital, Ulaanbaatar.

snippet.title: Are Ethiopia's Oromo being violently repressed? - UpFront
snippet.description:
More than 400 Oromos have been killed and tens of thousands arrested since November, a recent report by Human Rights Watch, or HRW, found. The Ethiopian government says that some protesters who are from Ethiopia's largest ethnic group have died, but HRW is "very generous with numbers", and that protests have been overrun by armed groups.

The latest round of protests began over a government plan to expand Addis Ababa, the nation's capital, to parts of the surrounding Oromia region. The government's plan has since been cancelled, but protests have continued over what Oromos say is the long-standing marginalisation of the Oromo people. 

So is the government guilty of a violent crackdown on the Oromos? In this week's Arena, Getachew Reda, the country's communication affairs minister, debates with Lencho Bati, an executive committee member of the Oromo Democratic Front.

snippet.title: Al Jazeera Special - Brexit: Britain at the crossroads
snippet.description: All eyes are on the UK, as Britons head to the polls on Thursday to decide whether they want to stay in the European Union, or leave.The UK is fiercely divided on the issue, with all living former British prime ministers, from both political parties, backing the "Remain" campaign.But nearly half of the Conservative Party's MPs are backing the "Leave" campaign, with Michael Gove, the secretary of state for justice, and Boris Johnson, the former London mayor, joining ranks with the far-right, anti-immigration party UKIP and its populist leader Nigel Farage.On the continent, the vote is being watched with much more concern, with fears that a 'leave' vote could deepen the crisis facing a continent already struggling with economic weakness, a refugee crisis and growing geopolitical instability.Apart from disrupting financial markets, a leave vote could bring far more dramatic change, along with many uncertainties.In this Al Jazeera special, Barnaby Phillips looks at the key issues surrounding Thursday's vote that could shape British-EU ties for generations.- Subscribe to our channel: http://aje.io/AJSubscribe- Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish- Find us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/aljazeera- Check our website: http://www.aljazeera.com/

snippet.title: Inside Story - Who's to blame for the worsening refugee crisis?
snippet.description:
The United Nations marked World Refugee Day on Monday with a new report that says forced displacement reached record levels last year. UNHCR said the number of refugees have reached more than 60 million people last year, or 24 people every minute. So, what's being done to stop so many people from leaving their homeland?

Presenter: Dareen Abughaida

Guests:
Maya Mailer - Oxfam's head of Humanitarian Policy and Campaigns
Salim Salamah - Head of the Palestinian League for Human Rights Syria
Daphne Bouteillet-Paquet - Senior Legal Officer at the European Council on Refugees and Exiles

snippet.title: Ex-Israeli spy chief: Iran isn't an existential threat | UpFront
snippet.description:
Efraim Halevy, the former head of Israeli intelligence agency, Mossad, says Iran does not pose a threat to Israel.
Responding to Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's argument that the Iran nuclear deal would "threaten the survival" of the country, Halevy says there is no "existential threat" to Israel, including from Iran.
The former intelligence chief also says he does not know if Israel has nuclear weapons.
"In order to be head of Mossad, I don't have to be a person who knows whether we have nukes or not," Halevy tells Mehdi Hasan.
Watch more from Mehdi Hasan's interview with Efraim Halevy in which they discuss Israeli politics, the peace process and Halevy's time in the Mossad.
Al Jazeera's Patty Culhane reports from Washington.

ms.title: Ketua mata-mata bekas Israel: Iran bukanlah ancaman eksistensi | UpFront
ms.description:
Efraim Halevy, bekas ketua agensi perisikan Israel, Mossad, mengatakan Iran tidak menimbulkan ancaman kepada Israel.

Menjawab hujah Perdana Menteri Israel Benjamin Netanyahu bahawa perjanjian nuklear Iran akan "mengancam kelangsungan hidup" negara ini, Halevy mengatakan tidak ada "ancaman eksistensial" bagi Israel, termasuk dari Iran.

Ketua perisikan bekas juga mengatakan dia tidak tahu apakah Israel memiliki senjata nuklir.

"Untuk menjadi ketua Mossad, saya tidak perlu menjadi orang yang tahu sama ada kita mempunyai nukes atau tidak," kata Halevy kepada Mehdi Hasan.

Tonton lebih banyak lagi daripada wawancara Mehdi Hasan dengan Efraim Halevy di mana mereka membincangkan politik Israel, proses damai dan masa Halevy di Mossad.

Laporan Al Jazeera Patty Culhane dari Washington.

fa.title: رئیس جاسوسی اسرائیل: ایران یک تهدید موجود نیست | UpFront
fa.description:
Efraim Halevy، رئیس سابق آژانس اطلاعاتی اسرائیل، موساد، می گوید ایران به اسرائیل تهدید نمی کند.

هیلوی می گوید: "با توجه به استدلال بنجامین نتانیاهو، نخست وزیر اسرائیل مبنی بر اینکه معامله هسته ای ایران" بقای "کشور را تهدید می کند،" هیچ تهدیدی برای اسرائیل، از جمله ایران وجود ندارد. "

رئیس سابق اطلاعات همچنین می گوید که نمی داند آیا اسرائیل سلاح هسته ای دارد یا خیر.

هیلوی به مهدی حسن می گوید: "برای اینکه رئیس موساد باشد، من مجبور نیستم فردی باشم که می داند که آیا ما هستیم یا خیر."

تماشای بیشتر از مصاحبه مهدی حسن با ابراهیم حلی، که در آن در مورد سیاست های اسرائیل، روند صلح و زمان حلی در موساد صحبت می کنند.

پتسی کالهان از مجله الجزیره از واشنگتن گزارش می دهد.

tr.title: Eski İsrail casus şefi: İran varoluşsal bir tehdit değil | UpFront
tr.description:
İsrailli istihbarat teşkilatı Mossad'ın eski başkanı Efraim Halevy, İran'ın İsrail'e bir tehdit oluşturmadığını söyledi.

İsrail Başbakanı Benjamin Netanyahu'nun İran'ın nükleer anlaşmasının ülkenin “hayatta kalmasını tehdit edeceği” iddiasına yanıt olarak Halevy, İran'ın da aralarında bulunduğu İsrail'e “varoluşsal bir tehdit” olmadığını söylüyor.

Eski istihbarat şefi, İsrail'in nükleer silahı olup olmadığını bilmediğini de söyledi.

Halevy, Mehdi Moss'a şöyle diyor: “Mossad'ın başı olmak için, nükleer silahların olup olmadığını bilen bir kişi olmak zorunda değilim.

Mehdi Hasan'ın İsrail siyasetini, barış sürecini ve Halday'ın Mossad'daki zamanını tartıştığı Efraim Halevy ile yaptığı röportajdan daha fazlasını izleyin.

El Cezir’in Patty Culhane’si Washington’dan geliyor.

hi.title: पूर्व इजरायली जासूस प्रमुख: ईरान एक अस्तित्व के लिए खतरा नहीं है | अग्रिम
hi.description:
इजरायल की खुफिया एजेंसी मोसाद के पूर्व प्रमुख एफ़्रैम हेलीवी का कहना है कि ईरान इजरायल के लिए खतरा नहीं है।

इजरायल के प्रधान मंत्री बेंजामिन नेतन्याहू के इस तर्क पर प्रतिक्रिया देते हुए कि ईरान परमाणु समझौता देश के "अस्तित्व के लिए खतरा" होगा, हेलीवी का कहना है कि ईरान सहित इजरायल के लिए कोई "अस्तित्ववादी खतरा" नहीं है।

पूर्व खुफिया प्रमुख यह भी कहते हैं कि उन्हें नहीं पता कि इजरायल के पास परमाणु हथियार हैं या नहीं।

"मोसाद का प्रमुख होने के लिए, मुझे ऐसा व्यक्ति नहीं होना चाहिए जो जानता है कि हमारे पास नक्स हैं या नहीं," हेली ने मेहदी हसन से कहा।

इफ्राईम हेलीवी के साथ मेहदी हसन के साक्षात्कार से अधिक देखें जिसमें वे इजरायल की राजनीति, शांति प्रक्रिया और हलावी के समय मोसाद में चर्चा करते हैं।

वाशिंगटन से अल जज़ीरा की पैटी कुल्हाने की रिपोर्ट।

ar.title: رئيس المخابرات الإسرائيلي السابق: إيران ليست تهديدًا وجوديًا صريح
ar.description:
يقول إفرايم هليفي ، الرئيس السابق لوكالة المخابرات الإسرائيلية ، الموساد ، إن إيران لا تشكل تهديدًا لإسرائيل.

وردا على حجة رئيس الوزراء الإسرائيلي بنيامين نتنياهو بأن الاتفاق النووي الإيراني "سيهدد بقاء" البلاد ، يقول هاليفي إنه لا يوجد "تهديد وجودي" لإسرائيل ، بما في ذلك من إيران.

كما قال رئيس المخابرات السابق إنه لا يعرف ما إذا كانت إسرائيل تمتلك أسلحة نووية.

"من أجل أن يكون رئيس الموساد ، لا يجب أن أكون شخصًا يعرف ما إذا كان لدينا أسلحة نووية أم لا" ، يقول هاليفي للمهدي حسن.

شاهد المزيد من مقابلة مهدي حسن مع إفرايم هليفي حيث يناقشون السياسة الإسرائيلية وعملية السلام ووقت هاليفي في الموساد.

الجزيرة باتي Culhane تقارير من واشنطن.

iw.title: ראש המרגלים הישראלי לשעבר: איראן אינה איום קיומי Upfront
iw.description:
אפרים הלוי, ראש סוכנות המודיעין הישראלית לשעבר, מוסד, אומר כי איראן אינה מהווה איום על ישראל.

בהתייחסו לטענתו של ראש ממשלת ישראל, בנימין נתניהו, כי הסכם הגרעין האיראני "יאיים על הישרדותה" של המדינה, אומר הלוי כי אין "איום קיומי" לישראל, כולל מאיראן.

ראש המודיעין לשעבר גם אומר שהוא אינו יודע אם לישראל נשק גרעיני.

"כדי להיות ראש המוסד, אני לא צריך להיות אדם שיודע אם יש לנו גרעין או לא", אומר הלוי חסן.

צפו עוד בראיון של מהדי חסן עם אפרים הלוי, שבו הם דנים בפוליטיקה הישראלית, בתהליך השלום ובזמן של המוסד.

אל-ג'זירה, פאטי קולהאן, מדווחת מוושינגטון.

snippet.title: Ex-Mossad head on Israel medical aid to al-Nusra Front - UpFront
snippet.description:
The former head of Israel's intelligence agency, Mossad, defends the country's treatment of al-Nusra Front fighters on the Syrian border.

In this web extra, Efraim Halevy tells Mehdi Hasan that he is not concerned that Israel had treated fighters in Syria from al-Nusra Front who some say is al-Qaeda's Syrian branch.

"It's always useful […] to deal with your enemies in a humane way," Halevy says.

When pressed on whether he believed the assistance was purely humanitarian Halevy responds, "I didn't say there's no tactical [consideration]. I said the main consideration, the immediate consideration is humane."

Halevy also says he would not support the treatment of wounded Hezbollah fighters because Israel had been targeted by Hezbollah, but "not specifically targeted by al-Qaeda"

Watch more from Mehdi Hasan's interview with Efraim Halevy in which they discuss Israeli politics, the peace process and Halevy’s time in the Mossad.

iw.title: ראש המוסד לשעבר על הסיוע הרפואי של ישראל לחזית אל-נוסרה - למעלה
iw.description:
ראש המוסד לשעבר, המוסד, מגן על יחסה של ישראל ללוחמי "אל-נוסרה" בגבול סוריה. 

 בהרחבה זו, אומר אפרים הלוי, הוא אינו חושש שישראל טיפלה בלוחמים בסוריה מחזית אל-נוסרה, שלדבריהם הסניף הסורי של אל-קאעידה. 

 "זה תמיד שימושי [...] להתמודד עם האויבים שלך בצורה אנושית", אומר הלוי. 

 כאשר נלחץ על השאלה האם הוא מאמין שהסיוע הוא הומניטארי גרידא, הגיב הלוי: "לא אמרתי שאין שום טקטיקה, אמרתי את השיקול העיקרי, השיקול המיידי הוא אנושי". 

 הלוי גם אומר שהוא לא יתמוך בטיפול בפצועים של חיזבאללה, כי ישראל הייתה ממוקדת על ידי חיזבאללה, אבל "לא ממוקד במיוחד על ידי אל-קאעידה" 

 ראו עוד מהראיון של מהדי חסן עם אפרים הלוי, שבו הם דנים בפוליטיקה הישראלית, בתהליך השלום ובזמן של המוסד.

ar.title: رئيس الموساد يرأس المعونة الطبية الإسرائيلية إلى جبهة النصرة - الجبهة العليا
ar.description:
يدافع الرئيس السابق لوكالة الاستخبارات الإسرائيلية "الموساد" عن معاملة البلاد لمقاتلي جبهة النصرة على الحدود السورية. 

 في هذا الموقع الإضافي ، يقول إفرايم هليفي للمهدي حسن إنه لا يشعر بالقلق من أن إسرائيل قد عالجت مقاتلين في سوريا من جبهة النصرة التي يقول البعض إنها الفرع السوري للقاعدة. 

 "من المفيد دائما [...] التعامل مع أعدائك بطريقة إنسانية ،" يقول هاليفي. 

 عند الضغط على ما إذا كان يعتقد أن المساعدة كانت إنسانية بحتة ، رد هاليفي ، "لم أقل أنه ليس هناك أي تكتيك [نظر]. لقد قلت الاعتبار الرئيسي ، فإن الاعتبار الفوري إنساني". 

 كما يقول هاليفي إنه لن يدعم معاملة مقاتلي حزب الله الجرحى لأن إسرائيل استُهدفت من قبل حزب الله ، ولكن "لم تستهدفه القاعدة تحديدًا" 

 شاهد المزيد من مقابلة مهدي حسن مع إفرايم هليفي حيث يناقشون السياسة الإسرائيلية وعملية السلام ووقت هاليفي في الموساد.

hi.title: अल-नुसरा फ्रंट को इजरायल की चिकित्सा सहायता पर पूर्व मोसाद प्रमुख
hi.description:
इजरायल की खुफिया एजेंसी मोसाद का पूर्व प्रमुख सीरिया की सीमा पर अल-नुसरा फ्रंट के लड़ाकों के देश के इलाज का बचाव करता है। 

 इस वेब अतिरिक्त में, एफ़्रैम हेलीवी ने मेहदी हसन से कहा कि वह इस बात से चिंतित नहीं है कि इजरायल ने सीरिया में अल-नुसरा फ्रंट से सेनानियों का इलाज किया था जो कुछ कहते हैं कि अल-कायदा की सीरियाई शाखा है। 

 "यह हमेशा उपयोगी होता है [...] अपने दुश्मनों से मानवीय तरीके से निपटने के लिए," हेलीवी कहते हैं। 

 जब इस बात पर दबाव डाला गया कि क्या उनका मानना है कि सहायता विशुद्ध रूप से मानवीय हैली ने जवाब दिया था, "मैंने यह नहीं कहा कि कोई विचार [विचार] नहीं है। मैंने कहा कि मुख्य विचार, तत्काल विचार मानवीय है।" 

 हेलीवी यह भी कहते हैं कि वह घायल हिजबुल्लाह सेनानियों के इलाज का समर्थन नहीं करेंगे क्योंकि इज़राइल को हिजबुल्लाह ने निशाना बनाया था, लेकिन "विशेष रूप से अल-कायदा द्वारा लक्षित नहीं" 

 इफ्राईम हेलीवी के साथ मेहदी हसन के साक्षात्कार से अधिक देखें जिसमें वे इजरायल की राजनीति, शांति प्रक्रिया और हलावी के समय मोसाद में चर्चा करते हैं।

snippet.title: Pakistan-US relationship: A double game? - UpFront
snippet.description:
Earlier this month it was revealed that the US Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) suspected its Islamabad station chief may have been poisoned by Pakistan's military intelligence service, the ISI, following the 2011 raid that killed Osama bin Laden.

While the reports have not been confirmed, some say such level of suspicion points to growing distrust between the two countries.

Those within US intelligence argue Pakistan is playing a "double game" by saying it supports the US' role in the region, while also supporting the Taliban.

Pakistani officials have denied these long-standing allegations, while others believe double games are essential because their interests do not always align with those of the US. Such distrust, however, has left many to wonder about the future of relations between the two countries.

In this week's Arena, we bring together former heads of the two countries' intelligence agencies to debate their sensitive relationship.

Michael Flynn, former Director of the US Defense Intelligence Agency under President Obama and author of, The Field of Fight: How We Can Win the Global War Against Radical Islam and Its Allies, is in debate with Asad Durrani, the former head of the ISI, and one of the main architects of Pakistan's Mujahideen policy in Afghanistan.

Editor's note: The Arena was recorded prior to the US drone strike in Pakistan that killed Afghan Taliban leader Mullah Akhtar Mansour.

hi.title: पाकिस्तान-अमेरिकी संबंध: एक डबल गेम? - अपफ्रंट
hi.description:
इस महीने की शुरुआत में यह पता चला था कि यूएस सेंट्रल इंटेलिजेंस एजेंसी (सीआईए) ने इस्लामाबाद स्टेशन के प्रमुख को संदेह किया है कि पाकिस्तानी सैन्य खुफिया सेवा, आईएसआई द्वारा 2011 के छापे के बाद जहर दिया गया था जिसने ओसामा बिन लादेन को मार डाला था।

हालांकि रिपोर्ट की पुष्टि नहीं हुई है, कुछ लोग कहते हैं कि इस तरह के संदेह बिंदु दोनों देशों के बीच अविश्वास बढ़ता जा रहा है।

अमेरिकी खुफिया के अंदर यह तर्क है कि पाकिस्तान इस क्षेत्र में अमेरिका की भूमिका को समर्थन देने के साथ "डबल गेम" खेल रहा है, जबकि तालिबान का समर्थन भी करता है।

पाकिस्तानी अधिकारियों ने इन लंबे समय तक के आरोपों से इनकार कर दिया है, जबकि अन्य लोगों का मानना ​​है कि डबल गेम आवश्यक हैं क्योंकि उनकी रूचि हमेशा अमेरिका के साथ संगत नहीं होती। हालांकि, इस तरह के अविश्वास ने दोनों देशों के बीच संबंधों के भविष्य के बारे में सोचने के लिए बहुत से लोगों को छोड़ दिया है।

इस सप्ताह के एरिना में, हम अपने संवेदनशील रिश्ते पर बहस करने के लिए दो देशों की खुफिया एजेंसियों के पूर्व प्रमुखों को एक साथ लाते हैं।

माइकल फ्लिन, राष्ट्रपति ओबामा के तहत अमेरिकी रक्षा खुफिया एजेंसी के पूर्व निदेशक और आईएसआई के पूर्व प्रमुख असद दुर्रानी के साथ बहस में है, द फील्ड ऑफ फाइट: ह्यू वे कैन विन् द ग्लोबल वॉर अॉॉस्ट रेडिकल इस्लाम एंड इट्स एलीज़ के लेखक हैं। और अफगानिस्तान में पाकिस्तान की मुजाहिदीन नीति के मुख्य आर्किटेक्ट में से एक है।

संपादक का नोट: अखाड़ा पाकिस्तान में अमेरिकी ड्रोन हमले से पहले दर्ज किया गया था जिसमें अफगान तालिबान नेता मुल्ला अख्तर मंसूर को मार डाला गया था।

ps.title: د پاکستان- متحده ایالات اړیکه: یو دوه لوبې؟ - مخکې مخکې
ps.description:
د دې میاشتې په پیل کې دا معلومه شوه چې د متحده ایاالتو مرکزي استخباراتو اداره (سي آی اې) د اسلام اباد د سټیشن مشر مشکوک شک لري چې د پاکستان استخباراتو خدمت، آی ایس آی لخوا زه اسامه بن لادن مړ کړ چې د 2011 2011 برید وروسته تعقیب شو.

پداسې حال کې چې راپورونه تایید شوي ندي، ځینې یې د دواړو هیوادونو ترمنځ د مخ په زیاتیدو باوري کولو لپاره د شک کچه ټیټوي.

د متحده ایاالتو استخباراتو کې د پاکستان استدلال دا دی چې "دوه ځله لوبه" کوي چې دا په سیمه کې د متحده ایاالتو رول مالتړ کوي، او همدارنګه د طالبانو ملاتړ کوي.

پاکستاني چارواکو دا اوږدې ادعاګانې رد کړې، پداسې حال کې چې نور په دې اند دي چې دوه لوبو اړین دي ځکه چې دوی د دوی ګټو تل د متحده ایالاتو سره سمون نه لري. په داسې حال کې چې دا ډول باور نه شته، ډیری یې پریښودل چې د دواړو هېوادونو ترمنځ د اړیکو راتلونکې په اړه وپوهیږي.

د دې اوونۍ ارینا کې، موږ د دواړو هېوادونو استخباراتي ادارو پخوانی مشران سره یوځای یو چې د دوی حساس اړیکو بحث کوي.

مایکل فینن، د ولسمشر اوباما تر مشرۍ لاندې د متحده ایالاتو د دفاعي استخباراتو پخوانی رییس او د جګړې ډګر: موږ څنګه د رادیکي اسلام او اسالمي متحدینو په وړاندې نړیواله جګړه وګټله، د اس آی آی پخوانی رییس اسد دراني سره خبرې اترې کوي. ، او په افغانستان کې د پاکستان د مجاهدینو د پالیسۍ یو اصلي مرکز دی.

د مدیر یادښت: آیرینا په پاکستان کې د متحده ایالاتو د بې پيلوټه الوتکې برید دمخه ثبت شوی و چې د طالبانو مشر ملا اختر منصور یې ووژل.

ar.title: पाकिस्तान-अमेरिकी संबंध: एक डबल गेम? - अपफ्रंट
ar.description:

हालांकि रिपोर्ट की पुष्टि नहीं हुई है,
कुछ लोग कहते हैं कि इस तरह के संदेह के अंक दोनों देशों के बीच अविश्वास पैदा हो रहे हैं।

अमेरिकी खुफिया के भीतर यह तर्क है कि पाकिस्तान इस क्षेत्र में अमेरिका की भूमिका को समर्थन देने के साथ "डबल गेम" खेल रहा है, जबकि तालिबान का समर्थन भी करता है।

पाकिस्तानी अधिकारियों ने इन लंबे समय तक के आरोपों से इनकार किया है,
जबकि अन्य लोगों का मानना ​​है कि डबल गेम आवश्यक हैं क्योंकि उनकी रुचियां हमेशा अमेरिका के साथ संरेखित नहीं होती हैं। हालांकि, इस तरह के अविश्वास ने दोनों देशों के बीच संबंधों के भविष्य के बारे में सोचने के लिए बहुत से लोगों को छोड़ दिया है।

इस सप्ताह के एरिना में,
हम अपने संवेदनशील रिश्ते पर बहस करने के लिए दो देशों की खुफिया एजेंसियों के पूर्व प्रमुखों को एक साथ लाते हैं।

राष्ट्रपति ओबामा के तहत अमेरिकी रक्षा खुफिया एजेंसी के पूर्व निदेशक माइकल फ्लिन, द फील्ड ऑफ फाइट: हाऊ वी कैन विन द ग्लोबल वॉर अॉॉंस्ट रेडिकल इस्लाम एंड इट्स एलीज़, के लेखक, असद दुर्रानी के साथ बहस में है,
आईएसआई के पूर्व प्रमुख और अफगानिस्तान में पाकिस्तान की मुजाहिदीन नीति के मुख्य आर्किटेक्ट में से एक है।

संपादक का नोट: अखाड़ा पाकिस्तान में अमेरिकी ड्रोन हमले से पहले दर्ज किया गया था जिसमें अफगान तालिबान नेता मुल्ला अख्तर मंसूर को मार डाला गया था।

en.title: Pakistan-US relationship: A double game? - UpFront
en.description:
Earlier this month it was revealed that the US Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) suspected its Islamabad station chief may have been poisoned by Pakistan's military intelligence service, the ISI, following the 2011 raid that killed Osama bin Laden.

While the reports have not been confirmed, some say such level of suspicion points to growing distrust between the two countries.

Those within US intelligence argue Pakistan is playing a "double game" by saying it supports the US' role in the region, while also supporting the Taliban.

Pakistani officials have denied these long-standing allegations, while others believe double games are essential because their interests do not always align with those of the US. Such distrust, however, has left many to wonder about the future of relations between the two countries.

In this week's Arena, we bring together former heads of the two countries' intelligence agencies to debate their sensitive relationship.

Michael Flynn, former Director of the US Defense Intelligence Agency under President Obama and author of, The Field of Fight: How We Can Win the Global War Against Radical Islam and Its Allies, is in debate with Asad Durrani, the former head of the ISI, and one of the main architects of Pakistan's Mujahideen policy in Afghanistan.

Editor's note: The Arena was recorded prior to the US drone strike in Pakistan that killed Afghan Taliban leader Mullah Akhtar Mansour.

pa.title: ਪਾਕਿਸਤਾਨ-ਅਮਰੀਕਾ ਸਬੰਧ: ਇਕ ਡਬਲ ਗੇਮ? - ਅਪ ਫੋਰਟ
pa.description:
ਇਸ ਮਹੀਨੇ ਦੇ ਸ਼ੁਰੂ ਵਿਚ ਇਹ ਖੁਲਾਸਾ ਹੋਇਆ ਸੀ ਕਿ ਯੂਐਸ ਸੈਂਟਰਲ ਇੰਟੈਲੀਜੈਂਸ ਏਜੰਸੀ (ਸੀ.ਆਈ.ਏ.) ਨੇ ਸ਼ੱਕੀ ਇਸਲਾਮਾਬਾਦ ਸਟੇਸ਼ਨ ਦੇ ਮੁਖੀ ਨੂੰ ਪਾਕਿਸਤਾਨੀ ਫੌਜੀ ਖੁਫੀਆ ਸੇਵਾ, ਆਈਐਸਆਈ, ਨੇ 2011 ਦੇ ਦਹਿਸ਼ਤਗਰਦੀ ਦੇ ਬਾਅਦ ਜ਼ਹਿਰੀਲਾ ਕੀਤਾ ਸੀ ਜਿਸ ਨੇ ਓਸਾਮਾ ਬਿਨ ਲਾਦੇਨ ਨੂੰ ਮਾਰਿਆ ਸੀ.

ਹਾਲਾਂਕਿ ਰਿਪੋਰਟਾਂ ਦੀ ਪੁਸ਼ਟੀ ਨਹੀਂ ਕੀਤੀ ਗਈ, ਪਰ ਕੁਝ ਕਹਿੰਦੇ ਹਨ ਕਿ ਇਸ ਤਰ੍ਹਾਂ ਦਾ ਸ਼ੱਕ ਹੈ ਕਿ ਦੋਵਾਂ ਦੇਸ਼ਾਂ ਵਿਚਕਾਰ ਬੇਯਕੀਨੀ ਵਧ ਰਹੀ ਹੈ.

ਅਮਰੀਕੀ ਖੁਫੀਆ ਏਜੰਸੀਆਂ ਦੇ ਅੰਦਰੂਨੀ ਦਲੀਲਾਂ ਵਿਚ ਕਿਹਾ ਗਿਆ ਹੈ ਕਿ ਪਾਕਿਸਤਾਨ ਇਸ ਖੇਤਰ ਵਿਚ ਅਮਰੀਕੀ ਭੂਮਿਕਾ ਦੀ ਹਮਾਇਤ ਕਰਦਾ ਹੈ ਅਤੇ ਤਾਲਿਬਾਨ ਨੂੰ ਵੀ ਸਹਾਰਾ ਦਿੰਦਾ ਹੈ.

ਪਾਕਿਸਤਾਨੀ ਅਧਿਕਾਰੀਆਂ ਨੇ ਇਨ੍ਹਾਂ ਲੰਮੇ ਸਮੇਂ ਦੇ ਇਲਜ਼ਾਮਾਂ ਤੋਂ ਇਨਕਾਰ ਕੀਤਾ ਹੈ, ਜਦਕਿ ਕੁਝ ਲੋਕਾਂ ਦਾ ਮੰਨਣਾ ਹੈ ਕਿ ਡਬਲ ਗੇਮਜ਼ ਜ਼ਰੂਰੀ ਹਨ ਕਿਉਂਕਿ ਉਨ੍ਹਾਂ ਦੇ ਹਿੱਤ ਹਮੇਸ਼ਾ ਅਮਰੀਕਾ ਦੇ ਲੋਕਾਂ ਨਾਲ ਮੇਲ ਨਹੀਂ ਖਾਂਦੇ. ਪਰ ਇਸ ਤਰ੍ਹਾਂ ਦੇ ਬੇਯਕੀਨੀ ਨੇ ਦੋਵਾਂ ਦੇਸ਼ਾਂ ਦੇ ਸਬੰਧਾਂ ਦੇ ਭਵਿੱਖ ਦੇ ਬਾਰੇ ਵਿੱਚ ਕਈ ਲੋਕਾਂ ਨੂੰ ਹੈਰਾਨ ਕਰਨ ਦਿੱਤਾ ਹੈ.

ਇਸ ਹਫਤੇ ਦੇ ਅਰੇਨਾ ਵਿੱਚ, ਅਸੀਂ ਆਪਣੇ ਸੰਵੇਦਨਸ਼ੀਲ ਰਿਸ਼ਤਿਆਂ ਦੀ ਬਹਿਸ ਕਰਨ ਲਈ ਦੋ ਮੁਲਕਾਂ ਦੀਆਂ ਖੁਫੀਆ ਏਜੰਸੀਆਂ ਦੇ ਸਾਬਕਾ ਮੁਖੀਆਂ ਨੂੰ ਇਕੱਠੇ ਕਰਦੇ ਹਾਂ.

ਮਾਈਕਲ ਫਲਿਨ, ਅਮਰੀਕੀ ਓਬਾਮਾ ਦੇ ਅਧੀਨ ਅਮਰੀਕੀ ਰੱਖਿਆ ਇੰਟੈਲੀਜੈਂਸ ਏਜੰਸੀ ਦੇ ਸਾਬਕਾ ਡਾਇਰੈਕਟਰ ਅਤੇ ਆਈਐਸਆਈ ਦੇ ਸਾਬਕਾ ਮੁਖੀ ਅਸਦ ਦੁਰਾਨੀ ਨਾਲ ਵਿਚਾਰ ਵਟਾਂਦਰਾ ਕਰਨ ਵਾਲੀ ਫਿਲਮ ਫੀਲਡ ਆਫ਼ ਫ਼ਾਈਟ: ਹਫ ਵੌਂਡ ਵੈਂਨ ਨੂੰ ਗਲੋਬਲ ਵਾਰ ਅਗੇਂਸਟ ਰੈਡੀਕਲ ਇਲਮ ਅਤੇ ਇਸਦੇ ਸਹਿਯੋਗੀਆਂ ਦੇ ਲੇਖਕ ਹਨ. , ਅਤੇ ਅਫਗਾਨਿਸਤਾਨ ਵਿਚ ਪਾਕਿਸਤਾਨ ਦੀ ਮੁਜਾਹਿਦੀਨ ਨੀਤੀ ਦੇ ਮੁੱਖ ਆਰਕੀਟੈਕਟਾਂ ਵਿਚੋਂ ਇਕ ਹੈ.

ਸੰਪਾਦਕ ਦਾ ਨੋਟ: ਅਰੇਨਾ ਨੂੰ ਪਾਕਿਸਤਾਨ ਵਿਚਲੀ ਅਮਰੀਕੀ ਡਰੋਨ ਹਮਲੇ ਤੋਂ ਪਹਿਲਾਂ ਦਰਜ ਕੀਤਾ ਗਿਆ ਸੀ, ਜਿਸ ਵਿਚ ਅਫਗਾਨ ਤਾਲਿਬਾਨ ਨੇਤਾ ਮੁੱਲਾ ਅਖਤਰ ਮਨਸੌਰ ਦੀ ਹੱਤਿਆ ਕੀਤੀ ਸੀ.

snippet.title: Should Israel negotiate with Hamas? | UpFront
snippet.description:
In the first episode of a new series of UpFront, we speak to three former heads of intelligence agencies.

Mehdi Hasan asks former Mossad chief Efraim Halevy about internal Israeli politics and the prospect of peace with Palestinians.

We also debate Afghanistan, the US and Pakistan with Asad Durrani, the former head of Pakistan's ISI, and Michael Flynn, the former director of the US Defense Intelligence Agency.

ur.title: اسرائیل کو حماس سے مذاکرات چاہئے؟ | اوپر
ur.description:
UpFront کی ایک نئی سیریز کے پہلے قسط میں، ہم تین سابق انٹیلی جنس اداروں کے سربراہ سے بات کرتے ہیں.

مہدی حسن نے پہلے مصری صدر کے سربراہ افریم ہیلیوی سے کہا کہ اندرونی اسرائیلی سیاست اور فلسطینیوں کے ساتھ امن کی امید کے بارے میں.

ہم افغانستان، امریکی دفاعی انٹیلیجنس ایجنسی کے سابق ڈائریکٹر، محمد درانی، پاکستان کے آئی ایس آئی کے سابق سربراہ اور مائیکل فلن کے ساتھ افغانستان پر بھی بحث کرتے ہیں.

#AlJazeeraEnglish #Hamas #UpFront

hi.title: क्या इज़राइल को हमास के साथ बातचीत करनी चाहिए? | अग्रिम
hi.description:
अपफ्रंट की एक नई श्रृंखला की पहली कड़ी में, हम खुफिया एजेंसियों के तीन पूर्व प्रमुखों से बात करते हैं।

मेहदी हसन पूर्व मोसाद प्रमुख एफ़्रिम हेलीवी से आंतरिक इजरायल की राजनीति और फिलिस्तीनियों के साथ शांति की संभावना के बारे में पूछते हैं।

हम अफगानिस्तान, अमेरिका और पाकिस्तान के साथ पाकिस्तान के आईएसआई के पूर्व प्रमुख असद दुर्रानी और अमेरिकी रक्षा खुफिया एजेंसी के पूर्व निदेशक माइकल फ्लिन के साथ भी बहस करते हैं।

#AlJazeeraEnglish # Hamas #UpFront

ar.title: هل يجب على إسرائيل التفاوض مع حماس؟ | صريح
ar.description:
في الحلقة الأولى من سلسلة جديدة من UpFront ، نتحدث إلى ثلاثة رؤساء سابقين لوكالات الاستخبارات.

مهدي حسن يسأل رئيس الموساد السابق إفرايم هاليفي عن السياسة الإسرائيلية الداخلية واحتمال السلام مع الفلسطينيين.

نناقش أيضًا أفغانستان والولايات المتحدة وباكستان مع أسد دوراني ، الرئيس السابق لوكالة الاستخبارات الباكستانية ، ومايكل فلين ، المدير السابق لوكالة الاستخبارات العسكرية الأمريكية.

iw.title: האם ישראל צריכה לשאת ולתת עם החמאס? | Upfront
iw.description:
בפרק הראשון של סדרה חדשה של Upfront, אנחנו מדברים עם שלושה ראשי לשעבר של סוכנויות המודיעין.

מהדי חסן שואל את ראש המוסד לשעבר, אפרים הלוי, על הפוליטיקה הפנים-ישראלית ועל הסיכוי לשלום עם הפלסטינים.

כמו כן, אנו מתדיינים באפגניסטאן, ארה"ב ופקיסטן עם אסד דוראני, לשעבר ראש ISI של פקיסטן, ומייקל פלין, לשעבר מנהל סוכנות הביון האמריקאית.

#AlJazeera אנגלית #Hamas #UpFront

snippet.title: Afghan Taliban names Haibatullah Akhunzada as new leader
snippet.description:
A scholar known to be one of the major decision makers for bombing attacks, is the Afghan Taliban's new leader.
The Afghan Taliban has appointed former deputy Moulavi Haibatullah Akhunzada to lead the group. 
He was close to the former leader Mullah Mansour, who was killed in a US drone strike. 

Al Jazeera’s Mohammed Vall reports from Kabul.

snippet.title: Inside Story - Retaking Fallaujah
snippet.description:
The Iraqi government says it has begun an assault on Fallujah, the first Iraqi city to fall to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL), back in January 2014.

Few expect it to be an easy fight.

Government forces had been surrounding the city for months. And ISIL has had time to dig in and bolster its defences.

Fallujah's recapture would build on a series of recent victories against ISIL.

And leave Mosul as the armed group's only remaining foothold inside Iraq.

But will the army succeed? And what would a victory mean for embattled Prime Minister Haider al Abadi?

Presenter: Laura Kyle

Guests:

Matthew Glanville - A former British soldier who fought in Iraq. He also served as a Special Adviser to the Governor of Anbar Province.

Renad Mansour - Research Fellow focusing on Iraq at Carnegie Middle East Centre.

Matthew Henman - Head of IHS Jane's Terrorism and Insurgency Centre.

More from Inside Story on:
 
YouTube - http://aje.io/insidestoryYT
Facebook - https://facebook.com/AJInsideStory
Twitter - https://twitter.com/AJInsideStory
Website - http://aljazeera.com/insidestory/

snippet.title: Top US general defends Donald Trump - UpFront
snippet.description:
In a special web extra, General Michael Flynn, former head of the US Defense Intelligence Agency (DIA) under President Obama, discusses his informal role as an adviser to presumptive Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump.

When asked if he supports Trump's proposal to kill the families of suspected terrorists, Flynn tells Mehdi Hasan: "I would have to see the circumstances of that situation."

"These are very difficult political decisions," he adds.

Flynn also refuses to condemn Trump's proposal to ban Muslims from entering the US.

"What I support ... is that we must understand where these individuals are coming from," Flynn says. He adds that he supports the "vetting of individuals and the proper screening of individuals who are coming from certain parts of the world like Syria."

The former DIA chief says, however, that he is advising Trump to be more precise with his language.

"There must be more precision in the use of the language that he uses as the potential leader of the free world," he says. "Those are the ... pieces of advice that I'm trying to get into him."

 
More from UpFront on:
 
YouTube - http://aje.io/upfrontYT
Facebook - http://facebook.com/ajUpFront
Twitter - http://twitter.com/ajUpFront
Website - http://aljazeera.com/upfront

"These are very difficult political decisions," he adds.

Flynn also refuses to condemn Trump's proposal to ban Muslims from entering the US.

"What I support ... is that we must understand where these individuals are coming from," Flynn says. He adds that he supports the "vetting of individuals and the proper screening of individuals who are coming from certain parts of the world like Syria."

The former DIA chief says, however, that he is advising Trump to be more precise with his language.

"There must be more precision in the use of the language that he uses as the potential leader of the free world," he says. "Those are the ... pieces of advice that I'm trying to get into him."

en.title: Top US general defends Donald Trump - UpFront
en.description:
In a special web extra, General Michael Flynn, former head of the US Defense Intelligence Agency (DIA) under President Obama, discusses his informal role as an adviser to presumptive Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump.

When asked if he supports Trump's proposal to kill the families of suspected terrorists, Flynn tells Mehdi Hasan: "I would have to see the circumstances of that situation."

"These are very difficult political decisions," he adds.

Flynn also refuses to condemn Trump's proposal to ban Muslims from entering the US.

"What I support ... is that we must understand where these individuals are coming from," Flynn says. He adds that he supports the "vetting of individuals and the proper screening of individuals who are coming from certain parts of the world like Syria."

The former DIA chief says, however, that he is advising Trump to be more precise with his language.

"There must be more precision in the use of the language that he uses as the potential leader of the free world," he says. "Those are the ... pieces of advice that I'm trying to get into him."

hi.title: शीर्ष अमेरिकी जनरल डोनाल्ड ट्रम्प - अप फ्रॉंट को रोकता है
hi.description:
एक विशेष वेब अतिरिक्त में, राष्ट्रपति ओबामा के तहत अमेरिकी रक्षा खुफिया एजेंसी (डीआईए) के पूर्व प्रमुख जनरल माइकल फ्लिन, रिपब्लिकन राष्ट्रपति पद के उम्मीदवार डोनाल्ड ट्रम्प के सलाहकार के रूप में उनकी अनौपचारिक भूमिका पर चर्चा करते हैं।

जब उनसे पूछा गया कि क्या उन्होंने ट्रम्प के संदिग्ध आतंकवादियों के परिवारों को मारने के प्रस्ताव का समर्थन किया है, फ्लीन ने मेहदी हसन को बताया: "मुझे उस स्थिति की परिस्थितियों को देखना होगा।"

"यह बहुत मुश्किल राजनीतिक निर्णय हैं," वे कहते हैं।

फ्लिन ने मुसलमानों को अमेरिका में प्रवेश करने पर प्रतिबंध लगाने के लिए ट्रम्प के प्रस्ताव की निंदा करने से इनकार कर दिया।

"मैं जो समर्थन करता हूं ... यह है कि हमें समझना चाहिए कि ये व्यक्ति कहां से आ रहे हैं," फ्लिकन कहते हैं। उन्होंने कहा कि वह "व्यक्तियों के परीक्षण और उन लोगों की उचित जांच का समर्थन करता है जो दुनिया के कुछ हिस्सों से सीरिया की तरह आ रहे हैं।"

पूर्व डीआईए प्रमुख कहते हैं, हालांकि, वह ट्रम्प को अपनी भाषा के साथ अधिक सटीक होने की सलाह दे रहे हैं।

वे कहते हैं, "मुक्त भाषा के संभावित नेता के रूप में उपयोग करने वाली भाषा के उपयोग में अधिक सटीक होना चाहिए"। "ये ... सलाह के टुकड़े हैं जो मैं उसे पाने की कोशिश कर रहा हूं।"

ar.title: جنرال أمريكي كبير يدافع دونالد ترامب - UpFront
ar.description:
في سياق خاص إضافي ، يناقش الجنرال مايكل فلين ، الرئيس السابق لوكالة الاستخبارات العسكرية الأمريكية (DIA) في عهد الرئيس أوباما ، دوره غير الرسمي كمستشار للمرشح الرئاسي الجمهوري دونالد ترامب.

عندما سئل عما إذا كان يدعم اقتراح ترامب بقتل عائلات الإرهابيين المشتبه بهم ، يقول فلين لـ "مهدي حسن": "يجب أن أرى ظروف هذا الوضع".

"هذه قرارات سياسية صعبة للغاية" ، يضيف.

ويرفض فلين أيضًا إدانة اقتراح ترامب بحظر المسلمين من دخول الولايات المتحدة.

تقول فلين: "ما أؤيده هو أننا يجب أن نفهم من أين يأتي هؤلاء الأفراد". ويضيف أنه يدعم "فحص الأفراد والفحص المناسب للأفراد القادمين من أجزاء معينة من العالم مثل سوريا".

ومع ذلك ، يقول رئيس مطار دبي الدولي السابق ، إنه ينصح ترامب بأن يكون أكثر دقة بلغته.

"يجب أن يكون هناك المزيد من الدقة في استخدام اللغة التي يستخدمها كزعيم محتمل للعالم الحر" ، كما يقول. "هذه هي ... نصائح أحاول الحصول عليها."

snippet.description:
The United States and other world powers say they're ready to send weapons to Libya, to help the UN-backed government fight ISIL.

snippet.title: Terrorists or Freedom fighters? | Head to Head
snippet.description:
During the conflict in Northern Ireland, the Irish Republican Army (IRA) was branded a terrorist organisation by the British government. The Republican fighters, however, saw themselves as a legitimate army fighting against the British occupation. It was a classic case of "one man's terrorist is another man's freedom fighter".

In this episode of Head to Head , Mehdi Hasan challenges Martin McGuinness, the elected deputy first minister of Northern Ireland and a former commander of the IRA, on his violent past; on why he sees himself as a man of peace; and on whether the Northern Irish Peace Process has lessons for other conflicts around the world.

McGuinness also argues for the importance of negotiations and talking to the enemy as the most effective way of ending conflict.

So, is violence ever justified? And when is it time to speak to the enemy?

Joining our discussion are: Professor Louise Richardson, a global terrorism expert and vice chancellor of St. Andrews University; Dr. Azzam Tamimi, the author of Hamas: A History from Within, and Charlie Wolf, an American political commentator. 


More from Head to Head on:

YouTube - http://aje.io/4a46 
Facebook - http://facebook.com/AJHeadToHead 
Twitter - http://twitter.com/AJHeadToHead
Website - http://aljazeera.com/headtohead

snippet.title: Do Arab men hate women? | Head to Head
snippet.description:
"Why do they hate us?"

With these five words in a controversial magazine article, Egyptian-American journalist Mona Eltahawy shot to fame, unleashing a devastating critique of women’s rights in the Arab world.

In the season premiere of Head to Head , Mehdi Hasan challenges Eltahawy on her views regarding the status of women in Arab states.

Are Arab or Muslim societies inherently patriarchal? And how does the narrative of Islam as sexist play into geo-politics and Western stereotypes of the Middle East?

Joining the discussion is Dr Aitemad Muhanna of the London School of Economics’ Middle East Centre; self-proclaimed progressive Imam Dr Taj Hargey; and Dr Shuruq Naguib, a British-Egyptian academic from Lancaster University.
